results.description:
Sleep ASAP is a sleep management education organization, striving to achieve two main goals: raising awareness to the scope and severity of sleep deprivation in all its varied forms, and making the widest possible range of (non-drug based) methods for sleep management accessible to sleep strugglers worldwide to support informed decision making and empower people to choose the most suitable methods for them.

There are multiple alternative and valuable solutions which exist and which can solve the frustrating problem of falling asleep.

we will be hosting local events as well as connecting the members to global events which will take place online. 

Our primary focuses are on;

Providing studies regarding sleeping disorder

Experts from various fields will share insightful perspectives and inputs from neurology, psychology, musicology, art therapy and more!

Global case studies and best practices will be shared

Our requirements from the group members are;

This group is meant to provide honest and open information. The exchange of personal information is only within this group

SLEEP ASAP is a NEW global community. It is intended to promote understanding, awareness and provide tools to help cope with these day to day problems.

Using any foul language or soliciting any provocative action shall ban the member from the group and can also lead to legal action to be taken by us against the offender.

Members that either are not affected by sleeping disorders OR that have personal intentions that do not deal with sleep disorders/insomnia, are kindly requested not to join nor participate

Our expectations

We wish to increase the Sleep ASAP global community. 10-15% of people suffer from chronic sleeping disorders and about 50% from temporary sleeping disorders. Like other mental barriers, the consequences of not tackling this issue affects the personal day to day business but also the general quality of life.

We expect group members to engage in group activities, to look in the information we will provide and make use of the valuable tools given here.

Sleep ASAP mega event

Aside from local meetups, SLEEP ASAP - Alternative Solutions will hold a global event which will take place in a few months. This will be a marathon of 24 hours that will focus on the aforementioned topics.


This group was created for those people that are struggling to fall asleep. Expanding the knowledge about creative and unexpected tools can provide a better quality of life.

Join us!
results.name: Sleep ASAP - Boston

results.description:
The Southeastern Hiking Club is open to all adults.  We are a laid back, diverse and social group who enjoy exploring nature with others on a variety of different trails throughout Blue Hills and beyond.


When:

We hike year round, every weekend on Saturday or Sunday at 1:00PM.  There are a few sunset hikes planned throughout the year as well.  


Where:

Most hikes are located within the Blue Hills area. Occasionally,  the club meets at other locations such as; Borderlands,  Moose Hill, Gilbert State Park,  Wilson & Whitcomb Woods,  Ellisville Harbor State Park,  Massasoit State Park, Freetown State Forest and Wompatuck State Park.........


Quorum: 

There is not a minimum  (or maximum) number of people required for a  hike to take off for DCR hikes. Typical hikes have anywhere from 15 - 35 people during summer/fall months, less during the winter months.   


Terrain, Distance and Pace:

The terrain can vary for each hike. The terrain levels below will be listed for each hike.

- Easy - (Mostly level terrain)

- Moderate - (Hilly terrain)

- Difficult - (Strenuous & steep)

The distance for each hike is typically between 2-5 miles.


Facilities:

There are well maintained restrooms at the majority of hike locations. We will try to make a note when this is not the case within each meetup notification.


Fees:

There is no fee to join the Southeastern Hiking Club.  

The majority of state parks & forests do not charge a parking fee, however there are a couple charge a  $2/$5 parking fee. We will try to make a note of which ones on the meetup notification. 


Hike Types:

Scheduled weekend DCR hikes are led by a Park Ranger or designated volunteer.  Club members also get together for non sanctioned DCR hikes which are referred to as "Alternates" within the title of meetup notifications.


Club Member Participation:

Some members hike every weekend while others only hike during certain seasons, locations or levels of difficulty. With that said, there is no set expectation for participation from club members.  Hike as often as you like.  


Park Ranger Recommendations/Requirements:

- Wear hiking boots, or sturdy footwear. 

- Bring and carry water on all hikes.

- Dress appropriately for the weather.


Disclaimer: 

During all events, everyone is responsible for themselves. The meet up organizer and assistant organizers are not responsible for the safety of participants. By joining the group, you acknowledge this. <br>
results.name: Southeastern Hiking Club

Celebrate the diversity of our people, cultures, housing and economy.
Foster the unique character of our residents, neighborhoods, hills and squares, and the strength of our
community spirit as expressed in our history, our cultural and social life, and our deep sense of civic
engagement.
Invest in the growth of a resilient economic base that is centered around transit, generates a wide
variety of job opportunities, creates an active daytime population, supports independent local businesses,
and secures fiscal self-sufficiency.
Promote a dynamic urban streetscape that embraces public transportation, reduces dependence on the

engaging recreational and community spaces, exceptional schools and educational opportunities,

natural resources.
Commit to continued innovation and affirm our responsibility to current and future generations in all of
our endeavors: business, technology, education, arts and government.

results.description:
Sooo there ARE Black people in Boston!!! What, and there is a gay community of people of color?!?!  Wait, where the hell are they? I'm sure you've asked some version of that question.

 So I started this group for answers!

Boston Black Queers - B.B.Q and Friends, is a meetup group for Black Womyn, in their late twenties to early forties, that identify as a member of the LGBTQ community, plus our friends and allies, living, working and playing in and around the Boston Area. While our events are all inclusive, this group will be a safe space to recognize and celebrate the African Diaspora and the variety of cultures and identities we represent. With that being said, this group is by no means exclusive to Boston, Black Womyn or Queers; after all, what’s a BBQ without friends?!?!


The goal is to build a community that may start on meetup.com, but that goes beyond the cyber connection. Looking for something to do with like-minded Womyn? Have a variety of interests? Want to meet other QWOC? If you answered yes to ANY of the above questions, please join us! The group is nothing without active members, so don't hesitate to attend, host an event, take/post photos and utilize our discussion board, so we can make this what we want it to be! As we grow, I'd love to add a few additional organizers so let me know if you're interested!

Guidelines:
Any member can host a meetup without organizer's permission. BBQ's are great when the weather permits, but of course, the more options we have, the better: Boozey Brunches, dinner, concerts, drinks, museums, art festivals, road trips, karaoke, bowling, paint parties, exercise/dance classes, weekend getaways, comedy shows, wine tastings, discussions, wellness activities, put lucks, dancing, the possibilities really are endless! Don’t hesitate to host a meetup, just be sure to attend if you are the Host.

Please update your RSVP to all meetups. It’s okay to change your mind at any point. Things can come up, but once you know you can’t make it or that you can, just take a moment to update your RSVP, or note it in the comments. As host, it’s nice to have an accurate attendee count.

Use the Discussion Boards if you have ideas for meetups, so anyone that’s interested in hosting can see what other members would like to do. Again, please be as detailed as possible. Looking forward to getting to know you all and starting 2015 right, with you!
results.name: Boston Black Queers and Friends (B.B.Q + Friends)

results.description:
Shorinji Kempo is a Japanese martial art practiced around the world, and designed to help practitioners realize their potential through the study of effective self-defense techniques. Regular practice involves cooperatively training with others and incorporates both hard (punches, kicks, blocks) and soft techniques(escapes, locks, throws). To complement this are seated meditation and explorations of the underpinning philosophy. Practitioners work together to become confident, well-intentioned individuals who can lead and inspire others.

The Boston Branch is affiliated with the US Shorinji Kempo Federation and the World Shorinji Kempo Organization (WSKO) in Tadotsu, Japan.
results.name: Shorinji Kempo Meetup

results.description: This is a group for people passionate about healthy living whether it means exercising, eating healthy, staying active or just making smarter decisions about your health. This group was started for a like-minded people who made a choice to stay healthy. The goal is to meet new people through fun events, stay active and learn from each other. We can have discussions about nutrition, fitness, cooking, health or anything else. We can go rock climbing, go out for a healthy dinner or just meet over coffee and talk about different things. No age restriction. Open to any suggestions.

results.description:
Please bear with me as I am still in the process of defining this group. I formulated this group to create a space north of the city where we can have civil discourse about subjects related to Social Justice and Environmental Issues. I would like to start with a book reading meetup. I am in the process of reading "The New Jim Crowe" by Michelle Alexander. I would like to meet with others also reading this book to discuss.

I hope this group will push us all to look a little deeper into issues that concern us. Let's do our homework to learn what is going on in our society and then share our discoveries. My goal is to arm myself with facts so that I may better articulate my point of view.

results.description:
Q: What is Piano Karaoke? 

A: Singers performing their favorite tunes, unrehearsed and on request, in their best vocal range or key, accompanied by a live pianist, in front of a live audience.

“A great place to try out your singing chops. This is NOT karaoke as you may know it, but a live piano player accompanying you with songs you bring to the table. Pop, Rock, Broadway, the great American songbook, Jazz — give it a try.”  

                                                         – Michael C., reflecting on his first visit

Much more info here!

results.description:
This is a group for people who want to be a part of a startup led by a technical founder. The problem with many startup cofounder events is that there are too many non-technical people looking for technical people to implement their ideas.  

The most qualified person to found a tech, web or mobile app startup is the person who can write the code. 

You may join this group if:

A) You are a technical founder with your own ideas.

B) You are technical and want to join a technical team.

C) If you are not technical, You want to help a technical founder with skill such as marketing and sales, general support, financing and business administration.

As a start, you may enjoy this excellent article from the founder of Ycombinator about his first startup, which was borne in Cambridge. http://www.paulgraham.com/avg.html
results.name: Team up With a Technical Founder

results.description: Hey, want to hang out with other LGBT folks in their 20s and 30s in the Boston area? Then come join us! results.description:
This group is for developers and architects who want to learn how to make software accessible for people with disabilities. The meetup will give people an opportunity to discuss and learn about:
  • How do people with disabilities use computers and the Internet?
  • What is software accessibility?
  • What is inclusive design?
  • Why make software accessible?
  • What are Web accessibility standards?
  • What is section 508 and WCAG compliance?
  • How to test Web, mobile, and desktop applications for accessibility?
  • How to fix accessibility problems?
results.name: Web Accessibility-  Learn How and Why

results.description:
**Always check for updates via this page. It is always up-to-date.**

Hello Folks,

I created this group for people who want to play a friendly-and-competitive game of touch or flag football on the weekends. Open to all levels- beginners, intermediates, and skilled players. Open to all genders. Skilled players are encouraged to be patient to the people new to football until they get a hang of it. Any serious insults or taunting will not be tolerated and you will be banned/suspended from this group and future games. It's okay to joke around, but please nothing serious. Games will be scheduled on either Saturday or Sunday around noon time. We will probably be playing 1 game a week. Not required to play every single game, just the ones you want to play.

Games will be set up 1-3 weeks(s) in advance for people who work and need to request time off. Address of field will be given when a game is set up. We will play mostly in Quincy but probably not at the same field each week due to other peoples' events. Let's all have fun, meet new people, and enjoy a game of football.

Members are more than welcomed to invite guests, but please inform me and the group first so we can set up games correctly. Thank you.
results.name: Quincy Flag Football Pick-Up

results.description: This group is for new or expecting moms. Moms who are interested in sharing experiences and supporting each other through pregnancy and parenting. This group hosts kid-friendly events and pregnant friendly activities but also parent night outs. I started this meetup to meet other expecting and new moms (I'm currently expecting my first in June 2015). Looking forward to meeting other expecting and new moms and enjoying parenthood!
results.name: New and Expecting Moms of Maynard (and surrounding towns)

results.description:
Greetings!
Welcome to the photography meetup group for expats and world travelers. 

Whether you have always called Boston home, or are just learning your way around, this photography group is a great way to discover the beauty of Boston. We are serious about having fun together. We will learn about Boston while honing our photography skills. And after class we always make time for socializing with food and drinks in the neighborhood we are exploring together.

If you've ever wanted to learn how to take better photos, but you don't want to get bogged down with all the technical stuff, then you're going to love this. 

This meetup group is for you if:

• You own a camera (or smart phone with a camera) and you'd really like to use it more, but you're not really sure where to start and what to do.

• You would like to explore different neighborhoods in Boston like Chinatown, The North End, and Beacon Hill.

• You enjoy meeting likeminded people from different cultures who love photography.

• Maybe you've taken a photography workshop before or tried picking up one of those thick, boring books, but you quickly got overwhelmed and overloaded with the technical stuff.

• You don't intend on becoming a "master photographer", but you'd like to learn how to take better pictures of things you find interesting. That could be nature, people, landscape, architecture, etc. Whatever you feel drawn to.

And the best part? The techniques you'll learn will have an immediate impact on your photography. You'll see an instant improvement and you'll also have an opportunity to get positive and constructive feedback for your work in a supportive environment.

If that sounds good to you, then I invite you to join our group. You'll learn a lot, meet some warm and wonderful people, and have lots of fun while you improve your photography, your English, and your knowledge of Boston. I'm looking forward to meeting you in person soon.

You can get started learning some of the practices by exploring my award winning book.

Flow-tography Take Better Pictures.

http://itunes.apple.com/us/book/flow-tography-better-phot...
results.name: Boston Expats: Take Better Pictures Fun Photo Workshops

topics.name: Downhill Skiing, XC Skiing, Snowshoe, Snowboarding

results.description:
Boston Metro Snowboarding and Skiing Meetup is for all the winter sports lovers. You can be a first time skiier or a pro snowboarder, it doesn't matter, it's all about fun. 

BY CAR: From Worcester (20 minutes)
Take Rt. 290 East to exit 19 (which is 190 North).
Take Exit 5 off 190 North, which will put you onto 140 North. Follow 140 North for approx. nine miles. Take a left onto Mile Hill Rd. and travel 1/2 mile to the Ski Area entrance on the right.

From Boston (1 hour)
Take Rt. 2 West to Exit 25 for Westminster/Princeton. Take Rt. 140 South to a right onto Mile Hill Rd. and travel 1/2 mile to the Ski Area entrance on the right. 

From Providence (1 1/4 hours) 
Take Rt. 146 North to Rt. 290 East to Rt. 190 North. Take Exit 5 Rt. 140 North nine miles to a left onto Mile Hill Rd. and travel 1/2 mile to the Ski Area entrance on the right. 

From Hartford, CT (1 1/2 hours)
Take Rt. 84 East to the Mass Pike East to Exit 10 Auburn to Rt. 290 East to Rt. 190 North to Exit 5 Rt. 140 North nine miles to a left onto Mile Hill Rd. and travel 1/2 mile to the Ski Area entrance on the right.

From Nashua, NH (1 1/4 hours)
Take Rt. 130 West to Rt. 13 South to Rt. 2A West to Rt. 140 South or Rt. 3 South to Rt. 495 South to Rt. 2 West to Rt. 140 South to a right onto Mile Hill Rd. and travel 1/2 mile to the Ski Area entrance on the right.

BY TRAIN: We'll meet at 8:15am every Sunday in North Station and get on the snow train to Fichburg ($20 round trip) where a shuttle to the Resort will be waiting for us. We'll be at Wachussett around 10:30am. Meet at 4:30pm on the same shuttle to Fichburg train station and back to Boston North Station (train is at 5:30). You can get on the train from different stations ( Porter Sq, Belmont, Waltham, Lincoln, Acton, Shirley... detailed stop on here http://www.mbta.com/schedules_and_maps/rail/).

TICKES/PASSES  http://www.wachusett.com/TicketsPasses/Dail...
results.name: Boston Metro Snowboarding and Skiing @Wachusett

results.description:
Mmmmaven (simply pronounced "Maven") is a passionate community of music lovers that encourages musicians, enthusiasts and kids of all ages to explore the power of combining music and technology. Established in 2011, we've thrown hundreds of events and graduated hundreds of students in the art of mixing and making music using the power of a computer.

This Meet-Up will serve as an easy to way stay on top of all variety of events: From pop-up vinyl shops to area demos at schools and museums. Of course, we have a good amount of free lessons and workshops in the laboratory as well, mostly on Fridays after work.

The bottom line is, if you're at all interested in the intersection of music and technology, you're a Mmmmaniac! You'll find a welcoming community of like-minded creatives, musicians, developers and DJs at our different types of events. 

For a short video on how the school works, watch this animated video:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=pMCkW9mA3nU
results.name: Mmmmaven

results.description: This group is for anyone interested in infrared photography. IR photography is making a huge resurgence now that most digital cameras can be converted to see in the IR spectrum. Many photographers are converting their older model cameras or buying buying new gear to have it converted. This group is designed to cover all aspects of IR photography. We will start by talking about conversion types and IR basics. We will also be doing critiques, round table discussions, infrared workflow and photoshop workshops as well as on location meetups to photograph landscapes and models. Whether you're a newbie or an experienced photographer if you're interested in learning more about this artistic medium come join us!
results.name: Boston Infrared Photography Meetup

results.description:
We are looking to bring together like-minded couples in the 495 corridor (Milford, Bellingham, Franklin, etc.) for social and outdoor activities. If you’re some combination of the following, you’ll probably like our group:

•You enjoy traveling

•You enjoy going out for drinks and/or nice dinners

•You like to stay active

•You’ve traveled, lived, or worked outside of the US

•You like new activities and experiences

We have young children, but are happy to welcome diverse members to the group. We’ll be starting out with activities for couples, but might mix in family activities depending on the types of members we attract. Activities will include happy hours, restaurant nights (dining out or in), card nights, other game nights, and outdoor-based activities. We look forward to bringing some fun to the lives of people who decide to join in.

results.description:
Cambridge Community Round Table brings Cambridge, MA residents, neighborhood associations and businesses together from all parts of Cambridge to discuss topics of interest to the community. This is a critical time to be involved, because the City is developing a Master Development Plan, which will change the design and vision for the city. Civic Engagement is critical to the function of democracy. The citizens and businesses of Cambridge have the power to influence the decisions made by the City, if they participate in the process. With greater participation from the people, the City can make better decisions that more accurately reflect the best interests of everyone, not just a small group. Greater participation will also help to achieve greater transparency of City activities, and a more open government.

Join us for free, casual and engaging discussions on how the City of Cambridge is doing a great job, and where there is room for improvement!

These events are organized by City Council Candidates Kim Courtney and Xavier Dietrich, who feel that there are not enough venues and opportunities for the community to be heard.
results.name: Cambridge Community Round Table

results.description: This is a group for women over 50 to socialize and enjoy getting together for lunch, coffee, wine, walking, museum and other outings. There has been a surge in people moving back to the city later in life. Hoping to bring together women in downtown Boston, newly moved from the suburbs or other areas, empty nesters, retired, those available to enjoy the city during the week. We can shape the activities to our wishes. A variety of small group activities can lead to more ideas and events. Activities will be focused in the heart of the city, available by the T.  Please note that this group is for day time activities on weekdays.
results.name: Boston Women over 50, Weekday Gatherings

results.description: Our group meets every Thursday at 7 pm in a beautiful old stone barn for a guided meditation followed by discussion and ,if time allows we sometimes end with a second meditation. We are like geese flying together,each one of us"drafts''off of the others, we support each other and share the journey . As this is held in a traditional yoga school we also "move into meditation" on Tuesdays at 5:30. Meditation is freely offered, a $5 donation is requested to help pay rent and heat . The "mindful movement" on Tuesdays is one of the yoga classes and the studio offers unlimited classes ,7 days a week, for only $30 for the first 30 days !

results.description:
The Boston Chapter of FWD.us is your home for Tech and Politics. It's a place to meet like-minded people, build networks and leadership skills, discuss issues you care about, and take action.

Our FWDMonthly meetups explore different topics at the intersection of tech and politics. Guest speakers share their expertise on the month’s issue. Afterwards, members break into teams to tackle specific challenges. From devising innovative ways to connect constituents to Congress to amplifying compelling local narratives, your efforts help fuel the movement for reform.

FWD.us is a nonprofit advocacy group founded by Mark Zuckerberg and other key leaders in the tech community. Our mission is to mobilize the tech community to advocate for legislation that will keep the American Dream achievable in the 21st Century. Our current priority is Immigration Reform.
results.name: FWD.us Boston Chapter

results.description:
Starting a restaurant/bakery/cafe is tough business. If you are planning to open a food establishment or you are already running one, this group is for you. 

We have first hand experience in a great variety of aspects and we hope to contribute to each other's success by sharing information and resources. We also have investors among us who are always looking for smart business ideas. Some of the topics that we plan to cover are as follows: Real estate, shop design, construction, branding, menu development, staffing, operations, sourcing and suppliers, kitchen equipment, pricing, marketing promotions, partnerships, legal matters, accounting and finance, business expansions, franchising.

We are all lovers of good food and it motivates us to get to know more people like us.

Each month, the members present at the meeting will recommend the books for the following month, voting will be done on the spot - alternating genres. Books in second and third place may be forwarded to the next month for voting.  This is an open book group and we welcome men and women, young and young-in-spirit.

results.description: The South Shore Finance & Accounting Professionals is a group of peers working together to gain valuable leadership skills, while enhancing professional and personal development in the management accounting area. We welcome accountants, controllers, CFO's, accounting and finance professionals, and business owners who are interested in financial management of their business. We will seek to explore topics that we can all relate to or need some guidance in. Topics could include steps to build a strong accounting department, QuickBooks desktop or QuickBooks online, why Excel, when to or when not to outsource, risk management, delivering financial reports to non-financial readers, communication skills, what is the difference between a leader and a manager and many more topics as we dive in. We want a roundtable environment to connect with peers without having to travel to Boston or further. We want an open communication environment where participation is encouraged.

results.description:
Data Science is a broad, fast-moving field; peer-to-peer learning is critical to a successful data science career! Unlike other data science Meetup groups that focus on presenting data science content, this group focuses on optimizing your professional development. Members of this Meetup group will get and give personalized career advice, learn content and receive content recommendations from peers, and intelligently grow their professional network. The most successful practitioners have many mentors and even more mentees. Join us - your career depends on it!

When you join our group - please take the data scientist survey to fully participate!
results.name: Data Science Professional Development Boston

topics.name: Support for Parents of Special Needs Kids

results.description: This group welcomes parents of special needs children ranging from mild learning disabilities to more significant special needs. This is a "no judgement" group that meets to mingle and meet other parents who are traveling the same special needs path.  Most Meetups will be "a meet & and greet" for coffee or cocktails and chatting with other parents in a restaurant setting.  Don't miss the interactive workshops with topics that will help parents navigate their special education path with confidence and knowledge.  Some workshop topics include IEP Review, Understanding Evaluations, Negotiation skills for Team Meetings, Effective Team Communication, Effective Progress versus Lack of Progress, Educational Lingo, with many more events to come as we evolve as a group.  Q & A is always a popular way to end the evening!   So join us to socialize, make connections and learn how to effectively advocate and educate your special needs child. Lets build ourselves a community because it takes a village to raise a child!
results.name: North Shore Special Education Meetup

results.description: Put an end to boring weekends! Awesome Weekend is here to help people of all ages have the best weekends imaginable. Our small groups will travel throughout the Northeast experiencing the best of what the region has to offer. Join us today and have a great story to tell to your friends and coworkers on Monday morning!
results.name: Awesome Weekend - Boston

topics.name: Apache Lucene and Solr Open Source Search
Lucene Solr Nutch Mahout and Open Source Search

results.description: "Information Explosion" has been defined as the rapid increase in the amount of published information/data and the effects of this abundance. The New England Search Technologies Group (NEST) was formed with the goal of making this ever expanding information content and data "findable" using technology components like Apache Lucene/Solr and ElasticSearch coupled with some "best practices" for modeling and transforming your data for optimal relevancy and recall. We will explore topics such as search engines, content extraction, data modeling, text analysis, natural language processing, entity recognition, analytics and recommendation systems. Let's learn, share and solve business search problems!
results.name: New England Search Technologies (NEST) Group

results.description:
We're so happy you found us. You and the kids are going to LOVE our weekly adventures!

Our group meets YEAR-ROUND every Tuesday at 10am at various hiking trails in the metrowest area. It's a great opportunity to meet up with friends and enjoy some relaxing outside time and learn some new trails mostly likely right in your back yard! These events are FREE and appropriate for children up to 6 years.

Previously, I was a part of a great hiking group closer to Boston that met every week. Even though I have moved to the 'burbs', I still get out there every week with my family and would love to meet other parents who know the value of getting our kiddos outdoors.

The hikes are suited for caregivers who carry their children and for young children who toddle/run on their own. No stroller hikes unless specified in the details of the hike. Please dress appropriately for the weather and terrain with layers, appropriate footwear, hats, sunscreen and water. Be prepared for ice, mud, scorching heat and/or brisk winds! This is New England after all; though I don't expect them all in one hike. 

We stroll at a slower pace to allow the children to soak up the environment, caregivers can chat with a new friend and we'll try to keep the group relatively close together. Our trail will be short and simple so you are free to take another loop around. Also, if your little one's pace is REALLY slow (I was once in that group) you can linger on the first trail in and we'll meet up with you on the way out.

Remember, we're kid friendly. We're all parents and caregivers doing our best to enjoy the outdoors with young children. The trails are selected for ease of walking and are short enough for the young ones to endure.  We'll take breaks and spend plenty of time playing in leaves or snow, rolling over logs to check for bugs and skipping stones..... all things our kids should be doing and this is great place for it.

Please feel free to contact me with any questions. I'm happy to help!

See you out on the trail!

Emily Z
results.name: Kid Friendly MetroWest Hikes

results.description: We will become the largest social, support and active gathering of Type 1 Diabetics in Boston in 2015. If you want to meet others who are progressing with this challenging disease, learn more about the cause for diabetes and make an impact in the movement for better treatments and cure, then sign up now and attend our next event. The focus of this group is to learn the information available for Type 1 diabetes and eventually get involved in helping us improve our lives. This group is for people who want to gain valuable resources and friends and get involved in the T1D movement for treatments and cure. If you are solely looking for information but not wanting to bring any value then Go Type 1 Diabetes is not the right fit. Otherwise we will be offering fun social events and promoting advocacy, fundraising, research studies and community awareness opportunities along the way. Be ready to learn, improve your health and smile.
results.name: Go Type 1 Diabetes!

results.description: 亲爱的朋友, 你是否觉得独自一人在波士顿孤独寂寞冷； 你是否觉得感情不顺又不想跟朋友父母讲； 你是否觉得大多数时间浪费在电脑上； 你是否觉得情绪低落不想社交； 你是否觉得工作不顺利需要建议； 你是否觉得在一个英语环境里觉得自己是局外人； 你是否觉得人际关系出了状况想知道问题出在哪儿； 你是否觉得在工作/学习上成就感很低； 你是否徘徊在回国或留美； 。。。。。 这是一个专门为讲中文的朋友建立的互助小组。如果你是在波士顿地区念书，工作的年轻人，并且想要有一个地方跟背景相似的人相互鼓励，那就加入我们吧。如果你能读懂这段文字，并且觉得深有同感，那这个互助小组可能是适合你的。
results.name: 波士顿互助小组 Boston Support Group

results.description: This group is for anyone who loves craft beer! If you like craft beer then you know that the best and freshest comes straight from the tap, at the brewery. My motto is “Drink local, eat local, think local”, so if you’re from out of town or a townie join me in experiencing the local flavors of Massachusetts. I will hold one meetup every month at a different craft brewery in Massachusetts, mostly but not limited to eastern Mass. Most likely a brewery tour will be involved along with tasting, growler fills, if you so choose and a few surprises. I would also like to do meetups at different craft pubs around Mass, where we can have unique bottle shares (where everyone brings a unique bottle of beer to share with the group) and taste some of the craft brews on tap. Along with trying beer also pair those with some of the unique craft food of Massachusetts. If this peeks your interest please join, I would love to hear which local brewery, brew pub, and craft beer pub are your favorite! -Cheers!!
results.name: Beer Tasting Group

results.description:
The Boston Office 365 User Group is a community focused on sharing knowledge around Microsoft's Office 365's ever-growing, always changing suite of technologies. The group will focus on every level of interest, from those who are just "kicking the tires" to business users, Office 365 administrators and IT pros.

Discussions (and coming in May, meetings) will focus on every angle of the Microsoft platform, covering topics around Yammer, Exchange, Lync and SharePoint Online.

Topics may range from introductory sessions for new users -- even experienced hands can pick up new tips and tricks -- as well as more advanced technical subjects such as migrations strategies and integrations. This is your group.
results.name: Boston Office 365 User Group

results.description: North Shore Gay Young Adults is a group specifically for gay and bisexual college age men who enjoy meeting new people and having fun! Our meet ups include fun activities for all ages (not just 21+) such as going to movies, enjoying short films/stories over coffee, discussing lgbt issues, snowboarding/skiing, Hiking and more! This is the perfect group for people who aren't into the gay bar scene or don't fit into typical gay social stereotypes. You do not have to be in college to join this group! Just college aged (18-25) and not afraid to have fun!
results.name: North Shore Gay Young Adults (18-25)

results.description: Join me in this safe, comforting space, where joy and fun meet deep and sacred. Connect with your inner life force and dance yourself into a state of blissful freedom.  This class combines guided and freestyle movement to help you get out of your mind and into your body.
results.name: Prana Dance

results.description: Pirates, Bucko Mates, and Arm Chair Sailors all aboard! We have five vessels that ply the waters in and around Boston Harbor, and inner islands, taking area residents and visitors on historic and social cruises. I started this group for two reasons, personal and professional: meetup with other photography enthusiasts, I'm a Nikon novice,  and to develop a library of great images for our family owned company through contests, etc.
results.name: Boston Harbor Seascape Photography

results.description:
The Decentralized Autonomous Society opens shop in Boston with monthly meetings discussing how new types of technology (i.e. smart contracts and decentralized autonomous organizations) can facilitate a greater degree of human freedom and autonomy. 

In the early 90s the cypherpunk movement held its meetup in Palo Alto, working through many ways in which cryptographic technology could be used to promote human freedom. Eventually Bitcoin was born. 

Today we discuss how the second wave of blockchain innovation can enhance human freedom.

With presentations from:

Joel Dietz, SWARM / co-founder DAS on "The Philosophy of Autonomy and Decentralized Technology" 
John Robb, author Brave New War, on "The Road to Turkdom"
results.name: Decentralized Autonomous Society Meetup (Boston)

results.description:
We are AQUARIUS SANCTUARY CENTER FOR HIGHER LEARNING AND HEALING, we hope you can join us and participate in our monthly classes  and events like Psychic Development with Talented psychic Yulia Applewood, Reiki Certification etc., Spirituality 101 with Rev. Steve Wilson, Exploring Past Lives with Certified Hypnotist Linda Donalds, Dream Interpretation classes, Angel Events, Healing Circles and more, check our website for more info.

www.aquariussanctuary.com
results.name: Holistic, Alternative healing, Psychic development Classes

results.description: SALSA SALSA SALSA!!! If you are or inspired to be a Salsa dancer this is the meetup for you! Starting in February EVERY Tuesday night from 8pm until 11:30pm+ there will be Salsa dancing at Samba West in Framingham. The night will start off with a 45 min-1hr lesson provided by Black Mamba, followed by Salsa and Bachata music. You don't want to miss out on this event.
results.name: SALSA DANCING AT SAMBA WEST

results.description: We are an informal group of active traders, investors, and individuals interested in the markets that seek to meet on a regular basis to talk shop, network, and learn from each other over some beers and laughs. We have different skills, experience, and capitalization levels, but we can all learn from each other and have fun while enjoying each others' company. Most of us are members of stocktwits.com (free to join), but it is not a requirement. We are open to everyone! Join us, we'd love to meet you!
results.name: Boston Investors & Traders -- StockTwits Meetups

results.description:
The purpose for "Pagans & Witches in Greater Boston" is to create public events for Pagans, Wiccans, Witches, Goddess Worshippers, Heathen, Polytheists and other like minded magical folk to gather and experience a welcoming and affirming community in the Greater Boston area.


We are a growing group of individuals from various paths coming together to celebrate, network, and work towards filling some of the greater needs of the Boston magical community.  It is our hope that this group can to be a be a focal point for fostering a greater spirit of community under the Boston Pagan umbrella. We offer a sacred and safe space to gather, meet others, communicate your ideas and join in public ritual and social time.


We do not adhere or promote any specific religious tradition; we are not a coven or closed magical circle.  All who feel called to Pagan spirituality are welcome to attend, as long as they can be respectful of the space and each other.  


We do have opportunities for those wishing to take an active role in community event planning; please feel free to contact group organizers online or in person to discuss these opportunities further.


Blessings Always!
results.name: Pagans & Witches in Greater Boston

results.description: For you to see and find a workshop that could help you to improve your life.
results.name: Aquarius Sanctuary Center Workshops

results.description: A friendly group of poker players who get together on Wednesday nights to play cards. We mostly playing NLHE cash games, but will sometimes dabble in dealer's choice. A wide range of player skill. We try to strike a balance between competition and fun.
results.name: Dorchester Poker

results.description:
Are you ready to bust through the blocks and limiting beliefs that may be tripping you up in life? Are you ready to stop listening to your Fear Voice? Are you ready to work miracles? This group is for people who are ready and willing to make simple, consistent shifts in their thinking and actions in order to improve all aspects of their daily lives, including relationships, finances, bodies, and self-image.

My name is Michele and I am the Organizer of the North of Boston May Cause Miracles Meetup group. I am a Licensed Independent Clinical Social Worker, a Life Fulfillment Coach and I have been mentored and trained by Gabrielle Bernstein to be a May Cause Miracles Practitioner!

The May Cause Miracles Workshops are based on Gabrielle Bernstein's New York Times best-selling book. Throughout the 6 week program, you will learn how to create beautiful, radical change in all areas of your life by adding up subtle shifts every day and week. Though each shift is simple, consistently choosing LOVE over FEAR will transform your life in ways you may never have thought possible. Workshop members can expect incredible transformation through the 40 day/6 week program and ultimately, a life filled with abundance, acceptance, appreciation, and happiness.

The workshop is offered as a 6 week program where members meet weekly for 6 consecutive weeks and each week focuses on a different chapter OR as a 2 day weekend program where each day focuses on 3 chapters from the book.

$250 includes:

Workshop (either once a week for 6 weeks or a 2 day weekend)

Your own copy of "May Cause Miracles"

Access to a private Facebook group for members to connect, support eachother and share struggles and accomplishments.

Unlimited email support throughout program.

20% discount on individual coaching packages with Michele

Please email Michele with questions michele@blisslifecoaching.net
results.name: North of Boston "May Cause Miracles" Workshops

results.description:
This meetup is for any single man or woman over 40 who would like to benefit from discovering the latest information about, and receiving friendly peer support for, navigating dating in today's social landscape. 

We will meet once a week for 10 weeks for targeted workshops, with additional fun outings to practice what we are learning and to have fun! The workshops will include guest speakers, multimedia presentations, homework assignments which help you practice what you are learning, paneled discussions, and more. 

Have you ever wanted to ask the opposite sex a dating question in a safe environment, and know you're going to hear the truth about what they think? Have you ever hoped to be able to sit down with a group of peers and be able to ask your own gender what their dating issues, fears, and expectations are? Would you benefit from open, frank conversations with men and women your own age, about tips and methods of finding the mate you are seeking? Stop struggling in the dating scene and start enjoying it, from a wise, confident, intentional, approach that helps you recognize what you are really seeking, and how to take more beneficial actions towards your goal, and to spend less dead-end time and energy on efforts that lead you away from your goal.
results.name: Merrimack Valley 40+ Dating Workshop & Fun!

results.description: We transform regular buildings into beautiful, collaborative workspaces designed to create a thriving community amongst the thousands of entrepreneurs that we house. With 22 locations all over the world, we connect awesome businesses through weekly events and digital technology while providing amenities--from private phone booths to conference rooms--that give growing companies the stability they need to succeed. Join our group to come to our events (come on by!), or email boston@wework.com to schedule a tour!
results.name: WeWork Boston Events

results.description: Hoard The Spoils is an Independent RPG that I have been working on for a long time. The core mechanics are the D6 system where you roll 3 six sided dice (Two are the same and one is different) for all skills and combat maneuvers. It has a dark fantasy theme with some politcal intrigue. We can meet in or around the area and all the dice and food will be provided. I hope to meet a lot of fellow gamers and non gamers who want to try something new.
results.name: Hoard The Spoils RPG Play Test Meetup

results.description: Back Bay Meditation is a community meditation group, peer facilitated and free to all. Group sittings are held Saturday nights from 6:30pm to 7:45pm at Karma Yoga Studio on Newbury St. in Boston, MA above Trident Cafe. We meditate together to explore and expand upon our meditation practice.  Sits begin with a guided meditation, followed by a short talk and group discussion. All are welcome. Donations accepted to cover space rental.
results.name: Back Bay Meditation

results.description: Looking to find a fitness class that provides in-house childcare while you work out. Join us at Jazzercise Sudbury on Wednesdays and Fridays at 9:30am for a 1-hour Dance Mixx class that is sure to keep you coming back. Drop in for $15 per class. or Sign-up for a membership. Visit: http://jcls.jazzercise.com/facility/jazzercise-sudbury to sign-up today. Childcare available on a call-ahead basis for a nominal fee.
results.name: Sudbury Jazzercise Classes with Childcare (W/F 9:30am)

results.description: We are Real Estate professionals dedicated to educate the Lexington, Arlington and surrounding communities on the complexities of buying and selling real estate in a competitive market. Our goal is to help the community network, share successful ideas, and coach individuals on how to get the most for their homes when selling. Our goal is to deliver education and value to attendees. There is no fee and no commitment to use our services.
results.name: Real Estate Gurus of Arlington and Lexington

results.description:
Привет! 

This is a group for anyone who speaks Russian and interested in hiking. 

Looking forward to exploring the outdoors with everybody.  All skills levels are welcome to join. For each hike expected skill level will be posted. 

До встречи на тропe!
results.name: Russian Hikers of Boston

results.description:
Group update - sorry, we've reached maximum capacity.

This is a group for young professionals or students born in the 1980s/90s, and who live in Braintree, Quincy, Weymouth, Hingham, and surrounding areas.

Activities may include board game nights, checking out restaurants, bowling, video games, going to the movies, activities in parks, watching the Super Bowl, and anything else that's local and fun!
results.name: South Shore Young Professionals

results.description:
We are an independent bookstore that has been in Hanover, Ma since 1990. Come join us for writing, snacks, and writing advice with fellow authors. We host MeetUp Adult Writing Workshops (ages 18+) and Book Clubs (18+).

Find the bookstore online for more events and age ranges!
results.name: Storybook Cove Writing Workshops

results.description: This group will be following the format of Speaking Circles as developed by Lee Glickstein. A Speaking Circle is designed to give people the confidence and the skills to interact with others, to speak in informal situations, and to present in front of small groups. Examples of people that are drawn to Speaking Circles include: • People that get nervous when making a presentation or speaking at a meeting. • People that find it hard to make conversation at gatherings and social events. • People who lock up or feel awkward in social situations. • Anybody who wants to improve their speaking skills in informal situations. Imagine standing in front of any audience, feeling absolutely confident and at ease. That is what Speaking Circles can do for you. Whether you have public speaking anxiety or simply want to express yourself with greater clarity the experience in a Speaking Circle® will guide you toward effortless authenticity. Speaking Circles help: Business professionals become more effective, authentic and powerful. People expand their vision of what life could be like when they are able to be fully present, confident and authentic. People who suffer from stage fright to overcome their fears. At a Speaking Circle you are provided all the support you need to express yourself in your own time and in your own unique way, without fear or discomfort. Some call this depth of expression, “speaking from the heart,” “the authentic self” or “your real voice.” Whatever you call it, you know when you are there; you know when someone else is there. Use this link to read FAQs about a Speaking Circle. http://www.speakingcirclesinternational.com/Articles/Prin... See and hear participants talk about their experience in SPEAKING CIRCLES: http://youtu.be/Wi82ZIgioh0
results.name: SPEAKING FROM PRESENCE

results.description:
The group will focus on young people who want more out of life then to sit in a cubicle watching the days pass them by.  We want to begin a movement in order to help to ignite all young people to own their lives physically and financially an, through our contributions, create Freedom and a lasting legacy.  We want young, open-minded people to come network and brainstorm about how we can break out of the mold of college, job, loans, working 86,000 hours, retirement...  How can we help each other to dream about and create the life we truly want?

We want all young entrepreneurs looking for a group to help give them the ability, courage and freedom to dream big and think outside the limitations of ‘normal’ life, the space to realize they can design and create the life they want, and the skills, confidence, framework and support to make it happen.

We'll meet a couple of times a month to throw around ideas and help eachother gain the knowledge and experience of thinking outside the box.  The meetings will vary from happy hour networking to business-type presentations. We encourage all members to present ideas to the group!
results.name: START Your Life Networking (18-35)

results.description:
You’re wonderful, weird and complex and although four letters could never fully describe you, your Myers Briggs personality type is a convenient albeit lazy way to connect with other kindred spirits. INFJ (introversion, intuition, feeling and judging) is a personality type that treasures the exchange of ideas and craves meaningful relationships. http://personalityjunkie.com/the-infj/ 


This group is not only for those oddball INFJs, but any intuitive type in need of meaningful conversation with good people. As Cornel West said in one of his rambling videos, “I'm a bluesman in the life of the mind, I'm a jazzman in the world of ideas. It's true that you might be socially isolated, but you're intensely alive." If this resonates with you and you’re willing to forgo social isolation, join us!


***Our social group is geared toward young adults in their 20s and 30s. ***
results.name: Adventures with INFJs and Friends

results.description: This group is intended to be fun, friendly and open to all. It will host socials, dine outs and the periodic singles event. Organizers will attend early to welcome new and solo members. We want members to be comfortable and have fun. Please include a photo and first name, so we can easily identify each other. I look forward to meeting you all!
results.name: South of Boston Socials (and singles) 50+

results.description: This is a group for lawyers who are looking for more peace, well-being, enrichment and meaning in their lives. We are creating a community that offers lawyers activities, events and services to better manage stress in their lives and to increase their sense of well-being. Whether you are someone who is interested in participating in these types of activities or providing services to the community, we are interested to collaborate with you on your ideas about how the community can best serve its members.
results.name: Boston Community for the WellBeing & Enrichment of Lawyers

results.description: A group for Pacific Northwest transplants and all Seahawks fans living in and around the greater Boston area to unite and root for the Seattle Seahawks.
results.name: Boston Seattle Seahawks 12th Man Sports Fans Meetup

topics.name: Art Creating Art and Perfecting Our Art

results.description: The Lowell Art Meetup is the group that brings together individuals who want to talk about art and socialize with artists.
results.name: Andover Art Meetup

results.description: We are looking for fun couples to hang out with, people who just want to socialize, dance, have fun, play pool. We are mid-40's/50 and would love to hang out with people who are beyond our work life :-) Nothing against them, we just want to mix it up a little. All suggestions for meetups are welcomed.
results.name: North Shore Couples Meetup

results.description:
Everyone knows a "Nice Guy." He's the great listener whose female friends call him a catch, but doesn't have a date on Saturday night. He's the husband who tries to please his wife, but whose marriage is tanking. He's the reliable buddy who everyone turns to for favors, but his own life's in a shambles.

No More Mr Nice Guy is a book and plan of action for men written by Dr. Robert Glover, a long-time psychotherapist holding a PhD in marriage and family therapy. The book is all about enabling men to achieve what they want in love, sex and life.

This group is for men who have read the book and identify with the "Nice Guy Syndrome". It's a positive forum for motivated men to work through the book's breaking free activities, discuss your experiences and gain feedback. We organize monthly participant-run workshops for members, as well as social activities for networking and fun.

Important: This group is for men who are on the path of self-improvement. For this reason, it's a condition of attending our events that each participant has read the book. If you have not read the book, No More Mr Nice Guy by Dr. Robert Glover is available from major booksellers and online.
results.name: No More Mr Nice Guy - Boston (South Shore)

results.description: I lived in South Boston for 6 years, moved to Chicago for the last 3 and am on my way back to South Boston for good. I am a SAHM to my son Aidan (born 8/2/2013) and we are looking to connect with other moms with infants and/or toddlers. It is so important to have a great support system, since this journey of motherhood is wonderful but crazy at times. We would love to schedule play dates, holiday parties, park dates, moms night out, etc. Please join us if you are looking to connect with other moms and babes as well.
results.name: South Boston's First Time Moms

results.description: Hi all, and welcome!  Please join if you're a mom of a baby, toddler, and/or preschooler and you'd like to meet for walks, play dates, and little excursions. Hope to see you soon!
results.name: Moms of Woburn (and surrounding towns)

results.description:
The purpose of this group is to facilitate international travel discussions with local Boston members. Each year the group hosts a short-term Prague Spring Tour in May with the Intercultural Studies Program at Charles University.

The group will meet up throughout the year to continue education of Czech Republic, including language, sightseeing, and history. The group is meant to connect travelers together in the Boston area and spend time each year in Europe exploring. In addition, students may find the group particularly helpful for connecting to students and professors at the world renowned Charles University, in Prague.

Join the group now so we can begin planning local monthly meet ups.
results.name: The Intercultural Studies Prague Spring Tour

results.description: This is a group for those interested in using their yards (or containers on a patio) for organic edible gardening (vegetables, fruits, herbs). I anticipate activities will include: seed swaps (small gardens rarely need a whole packet of seeds), plant swaps (seedlings and divided perennials), help with other members' large projects (ripping out grass is easier with a crew!), as well as general knowledge sharing and sociability.
results.name: Salem Backyard Organic Gardening

results.description:
Morning Star Sangha is a Zen group primarily for young adults, but we welcome all practitioners.

Morning Star is a community of Zen practitioners in the lineage of Boundless Way Zen, a school which combines Japanese Soto and Korean Rinzai traditions in innovative ways that include basic Zen practices such as breath awareness, mindfulness practices, inquiry into the moment, shikantaza (just sitting) and koan practice in the Harada-Yasutani tradition.

Morning Star Sangha meets at St. John’s Episcopal Church, 297 Lowell Avenue, Newtonville, MA, starting in September, 2015. Plenty of street parking is available. We enter the church through the red doors along Otis Street.

Our practice schedule includes a liturgy service, 25 minute sitting periods, walking meditation, dharma talks, discussions, and interviews with a teacher. Talks and interviews will be offered by our practice leader, Boundless Way Zen Priest and Senior Dharma Teacher Michael Fieleke, and by visiting Boundless Way Zen teachers.
results.name: Morning Star Sangha

results.description: We are a group of Christian business networkers, meeting in Scituate once every week for the purpose of helping each other do more business through lead exchange!
results.name: South Shore Christian Business Network

results.description: Meet other IT Ops, Configuration Management, and Compliance engineers using BMC Software's BladeLogic Family of products for Server, Database, Network and Middleware. BladeLogic helps customers reduce costs, eliminate manual and tedious IT Operation tasks, save time and money by consolidating configuration management processes across the IT infrastructure, and transform compliance, audit and remediation from a stressful event to a standard practice
results.name: Boston BladeLogic Automation Hub

topics.name: An Active Group for Active Members

results.description: This group is for all liked-mind people meetup to share spiritual experiences.
results.name: Exploring Consciousness Within

results.description:
Our four legged family members love to run and play and be social with other dogs. They bring their humans along for the ride, right? If this describes you, this is the group for you! We will visit local dog parks, state parks for the dogs and participate in fundraisers for local dog rescue and support organizations! Come on in! All responsible dog owners are welcome!

When you RSVP Yes to a meetup, you are expected to be present.  If your plans change (I know mine often do!), you are expected to update your RSVP.  If you do not update your RSVP to No and do not show up to the meetup, you will be marked as a No Show.  After 3 No Shows, you will be removed from the group.  You are welcome to rejoin should your schedule priorities change. 

Note: All dogs must be up to date on vaccinations and, if in a public space, licensed with their town of residence. This is for everybody's well being and peace of mind. Thanks for helping make this a success!
results.name: Calling All Dogs in the Metrowest

topics.name: How to Market Your Business through Blogging

results.description: Stay on track and get professional guidance for your blog. We'll meet at our mutual convenience one evening a month for a new workshop each time, led by a professional writer, support, idea generation, and most importantly, a group of peers to keep each other on track. Whether you blog professionally, for your company, or for fun, join like-minded bloggers for help with all your blogging needs.
results.name: Boston Bloggers Meetup

results.description: For all of us who love to follow Bruce Jacques, this Meetup group is the perfect place for us to collectively keep in touch and be the true Bruce Jacques groupies that we really want to be.  As many of you know, some of us have enjoyed this amazing entertainer for years at the Tap in Boston.  Still others know him from his shows at Mt. Snow in Vermont, Wachusett Mountain in Massachusetts, or one or more of the other clubs and venues where he performs in New England and New York State.  We hope that this Meetup Group will be a place where we can all share our thoughts and post information about him and  setup meetups for where Bruce is performing.  It's about time we all came together to share our stories about this amazing entertainer.
results.name: Bruce Jacques' Fans' Meetup

results.description:
This is a group for anyone interested in a non-toxic lifestyle. All levels, whether you are just starting to rid your body and home of toxic products or have years of experience are welcome. Discussions on the best ways to go about making a change, best products to use, etc welcome and encouraged. Learning from one another, sharing experiences, and having a group to lean on with questions and concerns is what this group is about.

Members are encouraged to share information about yourselves and promote your opinions and values. If those are tied to your business, then we are completely supportive of you sharing those details with the group. But please remember to use caution and be respectful to other members - while we support innovative ideas, this group should not be used solely as personal PR. Please use the message board/photos/files for information about your business, and host your own promotion events so that interested members can decide to attend if they want to learn more. Do not use general meetings to push products or services. If we suspect that a member has joined the group for the sole purposed of promoting his/her business, that member will be warned and possibly removed from the group.
results.name: Mansfield Non-Toxic Home Meetup

results.description: The group comes together in circle for the purpose of sending distant healing, always for the highest good, to ourselves and others, both people, animals and world events. When then each choose and share messages from divination or oracle decks. Sometimes inspiring materials are read to the group as well. Next the group divides up for the purpose of the practice of Reiki, both giving and receiving. Soothing music, crystal and metal bowls sound healing is also incorporated to enhance this loving and nurturing atmosphere, We affectionately describe the overall experience as an evening at the spa!!!!
results.name: Aquarius Sanctuary Center Reiki Share Meetup

results.description:
This group is for all the most awesome lesbian/bi women interested in connecting and having fun through indoor and outdoor fitness and adventure. It is for all skill levels and variety of interests. The goal is to get a nice group of women together to explore fun activities, get fit or stay fit. We will go on such adventures and activities as rock climbing, hiking, cross-country skiing, sledding, yoga, beach sports, kayaking, bicycling, and anything else people want to participate in that is appropriate for this group. All ideas and suggestions are welcomed and those who would like to help organize events are encouraged to get in touch. Activities will of course not be limited to Boston but will extend to other towns and areas.

Look forward to getting this community together and meeting all you lovely, fun and adventurous ladies! :)


*Please understand that this group is for creating a community of lez/bi women who are interested in fitness and adventure fun. As such, we ask that you provide a clear photo of your face to authenticate yourself. It doesn't have to be a closeup; we simply ask for authenticity. Membership may not be approved if it is not clear that you fit into these said guidelines. Please understand we do so with respect to the community and for maintaining as safe and communal a space as we can for lez/bi-identified women. If you have a reason that is important to you for not including an authenticating photo, please feel free to let the organizer know. Thank you.
results.name: Boston Lesbian/Bi Fun, Fitness and Adventure Group

topics.name: Free or Cheap Stuff to Do

results.description:
This is a great opportunity to network with people in the community, have fun and keep your money in your pocket.

Free events, open to everyone, most of which take place in the Roxbury, Mattapan and Dorchester communities. We welcome everyone whether or not you live or work here in the neighborhood. We welcome everyone including members of the Lesbian, Gay, Bi-sexual and Transgender community. We welcome people of all ages, ethnicities and backgrounds.

If you live in the community and have an interest in taking a leadership role by organizing free events. Please message me. I would love to hear from you. "You don't need to be an expert to organize an awesome Meetup. You just need something you care about and a desire to bring people together."

Include your name, phone number, general availability and any questions you may have. I will plan on scheduling a meeting with you or talking with you at one of the upcoming events.

Need a ride?: If so, please message me, call me or text me. 617-818-0403  I might be able to pick you up or may be able to find another member of the group I'm familiar with to do so.  Please RSVP first so I have a better idea about whom I'm talking to.

Why are there no events hosted in my section of the neighborhood?  If there are no events in your section of the neighborhood, it because I sincerely need your help.  This group is not just for one section of the community.  Please suggest location around where you live.  It you, yourself can't think of any good locations, please contact me anyway.  Maybe you can tell me a little about your neighborhood and I can find a solution.   Maybe I can show you what to look for.  I am trying to service the entire community - not just a portion.
results.name: Mattapan Roxbury Dorchester Free Events

results.description:
This group is those of us a that don't mind getting our hands dirty. The hope is to create a group of novices and skilled vegetable/fruit gardeners, to share our enthusiasm, knowledge, and seeds. Exploring things we would like to try growing, for example I am trying to grow sweet potatoes and asparagus for the first time this year. Maybe I should have called the group Middlesex County Backyard Gardeners.  Join us whether you have a small or large garden.

PS: My wife and I also run another Meetup group - N.E. Outdoor Couples.
results.name: MetroWest Backyard Gardeners

topics.name: Make New Friends, from all Walks of Life

results.description: Looking for early birds to walk together around beautiful Lowell. Weekdays 630am to 730am-ish . Meet at the park next to the parking garage on Market Street. Sometimes finish the walk at either the Club or the Owl diner.
results.name: Lowell a.m. Walking Meetup

results.description: Are you a private pilot (or aspiring pilot) for whom a weekend VFR forecast- or at least a forecast above minimums- compels you to ponder possible destinations? Do you look skyward at the sound of a piston single? If so, then join our Meetup to connect with others who share your interest in general aviation. We are for pilots of all experience levels, student, high time, low time, VFR, IFR, who live in metro Boston and want to meet other pilots to discuss and continue to learn about this demanding endeavor.
results.name: Boston Pilots: Weekend Fliers

results.description:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4zTgrsw2mdg&feature=youtu.be


EmpowHer You Meditation/Reiki meets every Saturday in the Back Bay at Karma Yoga Studio. Each Empowher You class consists of 45 minutes of Max Meditation followed by 30 minutes of Ensofic Ray (Complete System of Reiki) in a group setting. No meditation experience or religious affiliation required. Everyone is welcome!

results.description:
Charles River Wheelmen (CRW) is a group of recreational cyclists who get together for weekly bicycle rides and frequent social events in the Boston area.

We provide a high quality year round recreational ride program with a friendly social atmosphere.  Our rides are open to the general public. If you like our rides and continue to ride with us, we ask you to please become a member. Membership dues help support the CRW Ride Program.  As a member you will receive discounts at participating bike shops, which can more than pay for your membership.  You can also participate in our events open only to members or other events at a reduced rate.

To join the club, click on this link:  

http://crw.org/MembershipApplication.php?join&src=m
