results.description:
RELAXATION OF DUES POLICY:

As of May 16, members need not pay dues till they RSVP to a meeting. Former members, who did not renew by paying their dues at the end of their first month, are reinstated, and can enjoy the same policy as existing and new members. It may be a few days before these changes are shown in the membership list, but they take effect immediately. 

                                                                          --Murray, coordinator



:                     book review by Robin Harper

                  THE MANY MYSTERIES OF WATER

                            most of them explained

Many water phenomena, in its 3 phases, have been unexplained until recently. Most of the explanations are based on a semi-crystalline fourth phase of water that forms near a hydrophilic surface such as glass, water-bearing gels such as muscles, blood vessels, and plant roots, and the boundary between liquid water and vapor. These interfaces also form a light-powered microscopic battery that explains other mysteries.

The presentation will first expand on the following list of mysteries, then ask if anyone can explain any, and finally give an experimentally verified explanation. An illustrated quick reference will be passed out. The book that reveals all this is The Fourth Phase of Water by Gerald H Pollack, 2013, available as a free sample on Kindle.

Everyday mysteries

·  Wet sand supports heavy weight, but on dry sand you sink in

·  Tsunami waves can circle the globe several times before petering out

·  Gelatin desserts can be 99.9% water without leaking out

·  Diapers can hold 800 times their weight in water

·  Ice can be very slippery, unlike most solids

·  A broken ankle swells to twice its size in a couple of minutes

·  Warm water freezes faster than cold water

·  A tall tree draws water far beyond the 30 feet that a vacuum can sustain

·  Tree roots break concrete sidewalks

·  Insects walk on water even though surface tension applies to a layer only a few molecules thick

·  Clouds form as separate entities even though water vapor from oceans is uniformly spread

·  Joints don’t squeak even when you stand long enough to squeeze synovial fluid from between cartilage surfaces

·  Ice floats even though most substances contract when cooled

·  Ice can form and spread across a pond as you watch

·  Yogurt, colloids in liquid, has a firm consistency

·  Glass microscope slides stick together when wet

Mysteries from the laboratory

·  Microspheres suspended in a beaker of water migrate from the center to form a clear cylinder

·  Water droplets dropped onto a water surface dance for a few seconds before merging

·   Water dripping from a single container through 2 tubes and falling through 2 conductive rings into 2 metal containers, cross wired to the rings, eventually generates many thousands of volts and a long spark between the containers

Mysteries I’ve experienced

·  While microwaved, water in a glass explodes

·  Microwaved egg is peeled, explodes when bitten

An optional topic is how human instincts and politics stifle science, and have crippled for decades our understanding of the substance most essential for life.


        FOR NEWCOMERS:


This group continues and expands upon a science lecture group that has met monthly since 1984. We will have general discussion over supper, followed by a lecture or book review by a member, followed by questions and discussion on the presentation. Anyone may volunteer a talk at a previous meeting or electronically (they should have attended at least once), as long as the group feels the topic is of general interest to members. Talks should be aimed at the non-specialized scientific listener, but may include some well-explained math, if the topic requires it (e.g., for physics or math topics). Speakers are encouraged to provide a copy of typed notes for each attendee at the meeting, especially if there are pictures, diagrams or math involved, and may also attach notes to the meeting announcement, which will be made available to members at least a week beforehand. Book reviews should not assume attendees have read the book, though they are invited to do so. Occasionally, a science-based science fiction book or film may be chosen for review. Book reviews may include selected readings aloud from the book by the presenter. Blackboards will not be available, and LCD displays will not be convenient (except for occasional photos), as attendees will sit at a long table.

Until and unless we find another suitable meeting place to alternate with, future meetings will be in the Back Room of The Tavern in the Square, 921 Mass. Ave., Central Square, Cambridge, from 7-10 pm. The talk will begin about 8 pm. People may arrive as early as 6 pm and stay till at least 11 pm if they wish.

After a 30-day free trial membership, members will have to pay the $12/year annual membership fee to RSVP for meetings. This will entitle them to also receive email reminders of meetings.
results.name: Cambridge Science Meetup

results.description:
Calling all women who are currently trying to conceive!

I have developed this group especially for you.

Topics will be focused on teaching you everything you need to know to boost your fertility and increase your chances of getting pregnant.  Meetings will discuss topics such as:

• How to chart your menstrual cycle

• Natural ways to boost your fertility (foods, supplements/herbs, healing modalities, lifestyle choices)

• Identifying menstrual disorders that may be hindering fertility and what to do about them

• Mastering ovulation - everything you need to know about ovulation that will help you increase your chances of conceiving

• And so much more

It doesn't matter where you are on your journey to create a family, you will learn something new each and every time we meet, that will get you closer to conceiving.  I will be leading many of the sessions but I'll also be inviting guest speakers to offer up their fertility related expertise.

This is the go-to place to learn everything you need to know to get pregnant.  It's a safe, supportive, incredibly informative meeting.  It doesn't matter where you are in the process (just started trying, about to try IVF or have gone through several rounds of IVF) or what your circumstances (LGBTQ, single, advanced age), this is a judgement free zone and all are welcome.  I can't wait to meet you!
results.name: Cambridge Trying To Conceive Meetup

results.description: Hi to all women that are interested in developing bioinformatics tools. Try to answer to 2 easy questions to avoid misunderstandings: - why women? is because you hate men? - No, although men are weirds (kidding ... some of my best friends are men). It seems I am weird because I don't find women in this particular field of developing bioinformatics tools (see this, for instance: https://github.com/chapmanb/bcbio-nextgen#contributors. Only a few out of 23 contributors. And this is one of the most collaborative tools I know) - and ... why? maybe women don't want this ... - well, I want to know if that is true, or whether there is another cultural reason behind that. I can not find any reason why women wouldn't be interested in developing bioinformatics tools. If there is, maybe I find what it is and I can publish a Nature paper (kidding again ...) Another experience was the last hackathons of codeFest (http://www.open-bio.org/wiki/Codefest_2014), where only there were two women out of 60 people... I just don't believe that there are no more like me... I am weird but not because of working on this. So, please, if you are interested in learn how to develop tools in Bioinformatics, or you already do, but feel alone (kidding again) ... just join the meetup and help to increase woman population in this field. The idea of this group is to be a proxy to the developer community (for now men dominated) with the hope to get a great balance in the field (and hope one day this group disappears). Everybody knows that more diverse means more ... everything.
results.name: Cambridge Women BioInformatics Meetup

results.description:
C-OFFICER BOSTON

C-Officer Boston is a group of executives — CTOs, CPOs, and CSOs — who gather monthly at Google Cambridge for engaging presentations, lively round-table discussions, and beer and food. This group gives C-level executives in the Greater Boston community — from companies with cap sizes ranging from $20M to $12B — the chance to interact with each other more frequently. You can participate as little or as much as you like, with no obligation to stay in the group if you don’t enjoy it.


The Home Bar of Google’s Boston Common offers an intimate, relaxed setting to get to know each other, with a private bartender serving ales, lagers, and homemade pizza and wings.


Each event offers the opportunity to hear from three speakers (VPs, directors, and/or engineers) who each deliver a 20-minute presentation on topics of interest to designers and developers. Don't miss this excellent opportunity to meet and mingle with top talent and experts in the field. There's absolutely no agenda or pressure — stay only as long you want!

To participate, simply create a Meetup account with an e-mail address and then join C-Officer Boston. As a member, you can RSVP for the monthly C Mixers, send messages to other executives in the group, and even schedule and host events of your own.


We're easy to find, just off the MIT T Stop on the Red Line.


We look forward to meeting you!
results.name: C-Officer Boston

results.description:
More Joy Singles (Boston-Cambridge):

Joy is EMOTIONAL OXYGEN, we need it to breathe deeply, every day.  As a single person, true joy is irresistible, so get off your joy diet!!

Energize your love life, discover your life purpose, and experience them light each other up!

More Joy Singles (Boston-Cambridge) is a community of allies who enjoy conscious, creative, and outrageously fun Meetups! Our programs include:

• Playshops, such as "The Fireball Playshops" - improv theater classes about healthy and fun dating & relationships, and "The Life Purpose Time Machine Playshop" - get in (the Time Machine) and "test drive" possible future paths

• Workshops, such as "Great Boundaries" - a serious AND playful journey about developing great personal boundaries (get better at saying "no" and saying "yes" to create your best life)!

• Dynamic speaking engagements on provocative topics, such as "More Joy: Love, Sex, and Life Purpose"

• Highly interactive game nights, such as "Joy Time," a.k.a. "Gotta' Get My Joy Time!"

• Out-of-the-box outdoor journeys, such as "The More Joy Singles Adventure Scavenger Hunt"


Most events will be held in Harvard Square. Join us!

1. Meet great people
2. Have much more fun than you think you'll have
3. Learn how to manifest more joy in your life, present and future (Joy is the Fountain of Youth)
4. Practice experiencing more joy in the moment (at our events) - expand your capacity for joy

True Joy is Irresistible!

Daniel Phoenix, MA, received his Masters in Counseling Psychology from the California Institute of Integral Studies, and his Bachelors in Socio-Cultural Anthropology from Tufts University. He has been a speaker, workshop/seminar leader, and More Joy coach, since 1995. Daniel also loves scuba-diving and thunderstorms, but not at the same time.
results.name: More Joy Singles (Boston-Cambr): True Joy is Irresistible

results.description:
What is Couchbase?

Couchbase is the company behind Couchbase open source project, a vibrant community of developers and users of Couchbase document-oriented database technology. 

Couchbase Server is a packaged version of Couchbase technology that’s available in Community and Enterprise Editions. Couchbase is known for easy scalability, consistent high performance, 24x365 availability, and a flexible data model. 

Companies like AOL, Cisco, Concur, LinkedIn, Orbitz, Salesforce.com, Shuffle Master, Zynga and hundreds of others around the world use Couchbase Server for their interactive web and mobile applications.

Sign up to our Couchbase Developer Newsletter
results.name: Couchbase Boston

results.description:
Circlesinging is a spontaneous, improvisational community-singing experience, a little bit like a "drum circle" for singers. In a Circlesong, a leader starts by improvising a line of music and gives it / teaches it to one part of the circle. The leader then develops a second part that goes with the first and gives that part to another section of the circle. Circlesingers learn and repeat the exact part given to them. Soon we are singing a four part (at least) chorus that has never been sung before. This chorus can support individual solos. 

The effect: never-before-sung, wordless, fun songs, melodies, harmonies, & rhythms. The music may be glorious or goofy, complex or simple. Each circle is a unique experience, created by a spontaneously collaborating community. 

This is a "mistake-free" zone, for all levels of singers  -  we sing for the sheer fun of it! Sing beautiful harmonies without sheet music. Witness a circle of people creating music together. Come sing with us! Participants find it a joyful, exhilarating (and many have said spiritual) experience. Improvising and music-making can give insight into other life issues. Many notice cooperation, teamwork, and community. 

We take inspiration from methods developed by the unique and illustrious Bobby McFerrin and his collaborators, and from Circlesinging groups in cities around the US and the world. 

More about Circlesinging: 

If you are new to Circlesinging, you can hear and see examples in the videos below: 

1 -   In the following video, Bobby McFerrin creates a Circlesong with audience members, then riffs on top of it. Start watching at minute 5:25 (through 9:30)  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WznXAdYo8xc 

2 -  Berklee faculty member Joey Blake leads students in Circlesinging, in this video starting at minute 1:28. You also see individuals improvising solos on top of what has been created so far. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GFHAf1vR9cE&list=P... 

3 -   In the following video, you come into a Circlesong in progress; two sections are already singing their newly created parts as the video begins ….. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=t6WL7NYrT9Q 

4 -  Starting at minute 2:00 in the following video, see Bobby McFerrin starting a circle (and see also his playfulness with audience members) https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=PWriGiWw6i4&spfrel...

5 - Here's a fun one from the TV show "SingOff"  start at minute 1:00  the link is  

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=TNlmU4nPySI&feature=youtu.be
results.name: Circlesinging Boston

results.description:
Welcome. This is a walking group for men and women, single or married, who work or live in the vicinity of the walk, and who are interested in walking for fitness.  <br>

Here is your chance to get outdoors for some fresh air and to catch some sunshine, if only for one hour. We will provide support for getting in shape, staying fit, and great conversations. <br>

Bring topics to discuss whether from the current news of the week, books recently read, movies recently enjoyed, shows recently seen, or great recipes to share. The important point is to keep moving at a brisk pace to keep healthy! <br>

The benefits for walking are numerous.  According to the American Heart Association, walking for at least 30 minutes a day can help you:  reduce the risk of coronary heart disease, improve blood pressure and blood sugar levels, improve blood lipid profile, maintain body weight, lower the risk of obesity, enhance mental well-being, reduce the risk of osteoporosis, reduce the risk of breast and colon cancer, and reduce the risk of non-insulin dependent (type 2) diabetes.  <br>

So, join us and let’s walk toward a healthier you!
results.name: Lake Quannapowitt Walking Club

results.description: Join us for Feldenkrais Awareness Through Movement classes in various locations around the Merrimack Valley and northwest of Boston! Through guided attention and playful movements that recreate the way young children learn new motor skills, Feldenkrais Awareness Through Movement engages your whole self to explore the dynamic relationships in your body organization and provides a safe space to let go of habitual, often subconscious, tension patterns.  With a solid basis in physics, neuroscience, and psychology, the Feldenkrais Method offers a direct and effective means to reduce unnecessary muscular effort and attain greater stamina and ease in all your physical activities.  A regular Feldenkrais practice is great for improving coordination and flexibility, refining performance in your favorite athletic or artistic activities, as well as injury prevention and recovery.
results.name: Merrimack Valley Feldenkrais

This Meet-up group is created for local Haitians and Haitian Americans (entrepreneurs, business owners, college students) to interact and network in a fun, relaxing environment. We seek to share a unique perspective of Haitian entrepreneurship and businesses. Our members come from near and far (Boston to California to Haiti). 

Check out our calendar and photos to get an idea of our mission It's a great way to meet new people and have sharing your innovations.Fun, educational, diverse events which include brunches, networking, cultural events and mixers. We encourage you to suggest ideas for events, which hopefully will become official events. We hope you will join our group.

 If you join our group -please: 

1) include a current photo of yourself to help identify you at events. 

2) include your actual first name in your profile (last name is not required) 

3) fill out profile info

4) please be considerate of the organizer(s) and other members by keeping your RSVPs up to date and attending events when you have RSVP'd. A little courtesy and consideration go a long way, so please update your RSVP if your plans change. (see no-show rules below) 

No show policy: No Shows are cause for removal. 

1 no-show = warning. 

2 no-shows = RSVP privileges suspended for 3 months 

3 no-shows = subject to removal. Unfortunately we have had to remove some members because they have ignored these rules. 

Please be respectful to the organizers and other members. We hope to see you soon.

Nora 

Organizer

Sponsorship and Advertising Opportunities are Available. Contact the Organizer for more information.

@SHWFofficial #StrongHaitians

One advantage BNI has over other networking groups is that we only allow ONE representative from each profession to join, so that we are not in direct competition with one another. You can click on our chapter members to see what businesses are already represented. We meet every Tuesday morning at 7:00am at the first Baptist Church of Sudbury 162 Landham Rd. You are welcome to drop in for a visit. To attend please use this Meetup site or send an email to mtolland@hotmail.com and let us know how many seats to reserve for your party. Be sure to bring plenty of business cards!

results.description:
New England Irish Set Dancers is a group for any and all who are interested in Irish Set Dancing. All skill levels are welcome. No partner needed. Set dancing is Irish folk dancing (social dancing) and is a fun way to exercise, socialize, and meet other Irish Set Dancers.  

Group leaders and dance instructors from various parts of New England started this group as a way to share their local set dancing events and class information with others who are looking to find locations to set dance or those who are interested in lessons. Dance locations are in the Greater Boston area of Massachusetts (including Wakefield and Quincy), Southern New Hampshire (Durham), and Rhode Island (Cranston). We welcome other set dancing groups / locations in the New England area to join as Organizers. [It is free for members to join; Organizers pay a fee that is shared by all locations.] 

Read more about the group on the About page: 
http://www.meetup.com/New-England-Irish-Set... 

New to Meetup? See article about signing up for New England Irish Set Dancers:
http://www.meetup.com/New-England-Irish-Set-Dancers/pages/New_to_Meetup%3F_Find_some_general_info_here

We are a group of lively, fun, friendly, kind and talented people. Please join us!

Goodstitches is a national group with chapters opening all over the country. Check for ones in your area, on meetup.com. If there's not one yet then we are working on creating one.

What is the purpose of Goodstitches? It is a way that people in the quilting, sewing and needle art community can connect. By being a part of this group, you are going to be able to find others and share knowledge, ask questions, find supplies, post your pictures on the meetup site and much more!

Goodstitches will be working with sponsors that you know and getting good deals for you, the members of Goodstitches. We will continue to work to get you good deals with everything you need. Be it batting, thread, rulers, needles, yarn and embroidery threads...anything that you need to work on your craft, we are doing deals with the manufactures so that we can pass on the GREAT deals to YOU the members of Goodstitches.

The Goodstitches Team

results.description:
Get In2 Nature - Creative Fun 4 Grown-ups. Remember what it was like to be a free-range kid? We spent most of our play time outside. We used our imaginations, we were active, we explored, we made "stuff" in the woods and on the shore. ADULTS GET INTO NATURE MEETUPS are SUMMER CAMP ACTIVITIES 4 ADULTS. Whether we join together for easy trail hiking or biking, art activities or just silly stuff the meetups are sure to be fun and different (emphasize different). But you first have to join and then you have to show up and engage.

Scavenger hunts, archery, kite flying, painting & drawing, sandcastles, driftwood creatures, rock balancing, and much more await you. This is not a serious hiking group nor is it one that focuses on going out to eat and drink (though that might happen on occasion). The focus is on FRESH AIR & CREATIVE FUN OUTDOORS. So sign up! The more the merrier. Get your friends to join and make some new ones too.

Every grown-up is welcome to join but it is required that you to have a clear identifiable photo of yourself so that we can recognize you. And now for the DISCLAIMER: During all events, everyone is responsible for themselves. No organizers are responsible for the safety of the participants. By joining the group, you acknowledge this.

results.description: Our mission is to build a community through creativity that is affordable, approachable, and accessible to people of all professions. We host monthly Dinner, Art, + Music nights every Second Sunday from 6:00-9:00 and are always adding more events, including our new Book Club and Fiber Arts group. In the long run, our goal is to create the first community art hotel where everything in the rooms from the food to the furniture to the dishes to the soap is made by members of the community. Patrons who come to stay can buy what they use in their rooms, buy something like it in the gallery, or take a class and learn how to make it. The community art hotel will serve as the center of our creative community while also acting as an incubator to support artists as small businesses. We believe that everyone, whatever their background, makes something and our events encourage participants to connect with and celebrate what they make.  Learn more at: http://mirandashearth.com

results.description:
~ Embody ~ Express ~ Energize ~ Renew 

Welcome!  JourneyDance™ is a dynamic conscious dance form; it is a spiritual and physical practice that integrates natural intuitive movement and shamanic ritual. 

The mission of the practice is to inspire, ignite, and express: passion, joy, and wholeness. 

If music is your medicine and movement heals your soul join us for JourneyDance and feel grounded, connected, energized and renewed. This conscious movement practice is a playful and soulful celebration of life where our hearts open to a more joyful expression. Join this radiant dance community and Dance Your Whole Being.  

JourneyDance is for men and women of all ages and fitness levels!  No dance experience is necessary. No mirrors or expectation! 

We have monthly classes at Green Tea Yoga in Salem and at Roots to Wings Yoga in Byfield, most often on Friday nights.  Check our calendar for exact dates and times.

Visit www.embodyingsoul.com for more information and to register for classes.  You can also check out the Embodyingsoul & JourneyDance facebook page to keep informed about upcoming JourneyDance events.

When we dance, our purpose is not to get to a certain place on the floor. It's to enjoy each step along the way.~ Wayne Dyer

results.description:
Our vision is to use an entrepreneurial mindset to advance Asians across all levels of society. We are a 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization that is dedicated to the promotion of entrepreneurship and the sustainability of the entrepreneurial culture within the Asian American community in Boston. 

    In America, Asians are vastly underrated and underrepresented in positions of power. We represent 5% of the American population, but only 1-2% of leadership positions in political offices, corporations, healthcare, academia and entrepreneurship.

     Eddie Huang, entrepreneur, writer, and chef, puts it well: “I don't think people understand the model-minority stereotype is negative. You are boxed in. You have to untangle that to find your own path.” With the creativity and passion associated with entrepreneurship, our mission is to help Asians break stereotypes, give Asians a voice and support the Asian community.

     We will reach our vision by connecting, educating, and giving back. Connect: To build connections and create a vibrant community of entrepreneurial-minded people. Educate: To promote learning and help Asians develop an entrepreneurial mindset. Give Back: To provide resources to support our Asian community Programs.

Examples of our programming include: • Leadership Series bringing in successful entrepreneurs to share their story • Monthly Leadership Development Workshops • Summer Entrepreneurship Program for High School students • Directory of Local Asian Entrepreneurs • Monthly Newsletters • Mixers for Entrepreneurs • Book Club focusing on biographies of entrepreneurs


Make sure to join our directory to stay abreast of events and updates!

http://goo.gl/forms/9a34j5a4uV
results.name: Boston Asian Entrepreneurship Foundation

results.description:
Welcome to EF Education First's Meetup page for ed tech buffs in greater Boston.  Most people know EF as the world's leading international education company, and many are surprised to hear that technology, design and innovation are always at the core of our work in travel, language learning, cultural exchange and education.  From launching what has grown into the world's largest online English school with Apple back in the '90s, to our more recent work with LinkedIn on democratizing credentialing for global language learners, our innovation teams experiment with cutting edge and emerging technologies while driving our mission of opening the world through education.  

We're excited to start this group and hopefully meet a bunch of like-minded people in the region who are focused on using technology in the education space in their own meaningful ways.  In the coming months, we plan to host a series of fun Meetups to explore the challenges and opportunities we all face working in this unique space.  Learning from you is just as important to us as sharing the story of our 50-year technology legacy.  

Our first Meetup is coming up in a few weeks.  We're excited to welcome you to our spectacular new North American headquarters in Cambridge to chat, snack, network and imbibe!

Click the link below for more information.
results.name: Developers and Designers in Education - EF Education First

results.description: Welcome to the only beatboxing Meetup in Boston: the Boston Beatboxing Squad! (BBS) Do you beatbox? Do you want to learn? Do you want to improve your skills, or meet other beatboxers to collaborate? Are you a singer or rapper looking for a beatboxer to back your vocals? This group aims to recognize beatboxing (aka vocal percussion) as an art form and musical style. At BBS, we'll be hosting beatboxing technique workshops (learn a new sound to add to your repertoire!), beatbox jam sessions, beatbox open mics and performances, beatbox competitions, and technology workshops (loopers, recording techniques, etc.). Events will take place at various places around Boston with superb echo and reverb! (Think Kenmore station staircase, under bridges, etc.). Brendon Albertson (Green Beatbox) created this group out of a passion to give beatboxing the respect it deserves, just as any other style of music or instrument. A large network of beatboxers exists online, but to this day European countries are far ahead of the U.S. in creating an in-person beatboxing scene. Please support our cause if you're interested! www.greenbeatbox.com
results.name: Boston Beatboxing Squad

results.description: This MEETUP site is primarily for all of the Northern Bristol, Northern Plymouth and nearby Norfolk counties members of the Southeastern Massachusetts Time Exchange and also for non-members who are interested in following it. This MeetUp site is a bulletin board for staying in touch and up to date about Exchange activities in your area. Membership in the Time Exchange is not a requirement for membership in this Meetup group. It is a sister site of South-Coast-Time-Exchangers and Cape-Cod-Time-Exchangers Meetup sites. Time Banking is a means to foster community and mutual aid in this disconnected world. If joining on our EXTERNAL WEBSITE, exchangetime.org, people list their Offers of and Requests for help. When you need help you look to see who is offering that service and get in touch with them. A person providing help gets to "bank" those hours and "spend" them getting someone else to help with whatever s/he needs. It's not direct swap and no goods are exchanged. Just TIME. The idea is to connect and help people through an "alternative" economy. We hold monthly get-togethers, often potlucks, and sometimes also gather at interesting local events. We did a Repair Cafe last summer and plan future Skill Share events. See also hourworld.org.
results.name: SOUTH OF BOSTON TIME EXCHANGERS

topics.name: Networking with US China business professionals

results.description: Reflecting China's past achievements and looking forward, we believe great opportunities for the world lie amid the challenges China faces today. Ideas and solutions from both within China and abroad will be needed to face the many challenges on the road to China's development. We intend to host a high-profile forum to address these key issues in technology, innovation, and entrepreneurship in China, providing a platform upon which high-impact discussions and collaborations can take place. The Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT) is a hotspot of scientific research where technologies are constantly taking shape to address real-world challenges. As China faces many such challenges today, we believe this is an ideal time to provide an interactive discussion forum between China and researchers at MIT. We also believe that the core values established by MIT's founder William Barton Rogers 150 years ago—inventional wisdom, useful work founded on science, hands-on learning, meritocracy and hardwork, and service—have great potential to advance and develop China's future.
results.name: MIT-China Innovation and Entrepreneurship Forum

results.description:
The goal of this Meetup is to bring the community together to apply data science to improve society.   Some areas that will be addressed include crime, healthcare, transportation, clean energy; income disparity, among others.

The key aspect of this group is that its primary goal is Social Impact.  It is very important that members who join have a strong personal interest and commitment to working on projects that involve social issues.   We will be having training on data science such that if you are a beginner then we will help you improve your skills; to then in turn help you apply this to solve problems.  We will also have events, such as hackathons, where seasoned data analysts and scientists can immediately apply their skills to social issues.

The group will seek to include folks from many different organizations (including government, non-profits, academic researchers, community organizers, corporations, startups) towards working together on initiatives.  Furthermore, there are several existing Meetup groups that are also focused on social impact (though with a different focus, such as Volunteering, Civic Hacking/Coding, Open Government, or the like).  We will look to partner across Meetup groups to bring all of our complementary skills together. 

At our initial meetings, members will help prioritize as to what types of event formats each would like whether hackathons, weekly get-togethers, et al.
results.name: Data Science for Social Good

results.description:
Welcome to the Waldorf Class of 2022 Meetup Group, a website for Waldorf School of Lexington 1st grade families in Ms. Voss' class. This group is designed to continue building our community through social interaction and play, volunteer opportunities that support class/school activities, and many other gatherings that will bring our families together in a supportive, friendly environment. This site will be especially useful during the summer months, when children will be enjoying activities away from school but may want to stay connected to school friends.

The site also includes a Discussion Board. Here you can post family-friendly comments, questions, lunch ideas, articles, etc. Feel free to start your own discussion or add to an existing thread.

To view upcoming gatherings, click on the Calendar button. You can then click on the event name for all the details and to RSVP. If you RSVP positively, you will receive several reminders leading up to the day of the event. An RSVP with regrets will automatically stop future notices regarding this particular event. If you prefer not to receive notices from Meetup informing you of an event, you can change your Meetup settings accordingly. 

The Waldorf Class of 2022 is set up so that anyone in the group can add an event. If you prefer, you can send me a note with the event details and I will gladly add it to the Meetup calendar. 

We hope you enjoy this convenient resource. Please call or send me a note if I can help in any way as you get familiar with the website.
results.name: Waldorf Class of 2022

results.description:
This group is for parents of children born in 2011 and 2012 who wish to meet other working moms and dads trying to balance family life and a career!  This group will allow our little ones to grow up together around similar aged friends.  We'll have affordable activities with our Preschoolers in our neighborhood, like going to story-time at the library, having picnics at the Park, play groups, outings, potlucks, book clubs, and many, many more wonderful activities throughout Boston and the surrounding suburbs. We can also have events for just moms / dads, like movies, dinner, and anything else that looks like fun!

Our group is an open forum, so everybody is welcome to initiate and organize their own events to add to our calendar. Let's get together :)
results.name: Working Parents of Preschoolers

results.description: This group is for people who care about unleashing and engaging the collective intelligence, adaptive capacity and creativity of their teams, organizations, Boards, community groups, etc. Liberating Structures is about action, engagement and collaborative change – practiced through 33 (and growing) easy-to-use, powerful, and continually adaptive group engagement “structures” designed to surface insights, ideate, identify best practices, strategize, or help people see what they can do to make change happen. This group will be focused on exploring Liberating Structures through practice (doing them at the Meetups) as well as sharing experience / knowledge about applying them in work contexts and by exploring opportunities for collaboration and projects. This group is open to anyone; no experience necessary, just a willingness to learn and share.
results.name: Boston Liberating Structures Meetup

results.description: “when you are facing in the right direction, all you have to do is keep on walking…” If you are looking for a group of like minded women that can inspire you to lead a healthy life, in harmony with yourself, others around you, and in nature, then this may be the group for you! This is a group for anyone who has searched high and low for a casual, non-judgmental, fun-filled environment to explore almost anything related to health, wellness, mindfulness, and balance of the mind, body, and spirit. Come join a gathering of women (aged 21+) who may engage in a group yoga or meditation class, share stories, decide to read a particular book of the month, go out dancing, find a crazy outdoor adventure, or simply offer a space to just "be". A place to feel inspired, an alternative to a coffee shop or bar, a community that perpetuates understanding and support. Sometimes we just need to be around other women who "get it"!
results.name: 20-30's Women! Summer Fun + Wellness, Somerville and Beyond

Let’s change that. At this point, I’m just trying to gauge interest in the idea. Once we have a quorum, I’ll figure out the best spot and time to get together.

results.description:
CIC: Community, Innovation, Collaboration. A community of hackers, inventors, artists, and makers. CIC is a community organization founded to support people from all walks of life in their endeavors to create lasting, innovative change. Events produced by CIC cover topics like art, sustainability, musical composition, 3D Printing, writing, DJing, and more. All topics are curated with a focus on forward-thinking designs and solutions, and all events are free and open to the public. The formats of our events vary from after-hours networking to walking exhibits, hands-on activities, creative workshops, and group discussions. As we grow, we will continue to broaden the scope of our event offerings. We are interested in asking tough questions, and in providing the local community with a unique physical space to collaborate on exceptional solutions. This is an exciting time for human civilization and for CIC. Join our group, attend our events, and experience it for yourself.


Please note: Our goal is to create an inclusive and supportive environment, and as such we follow the credo of our sister organization Venture Cafe http://vencaf.org/credo

We believe that innovation is a social process fueled by trust, collaboration, and storytelling, and we thus reserve the right to limit access to any individual at our discretion.
results.name: CIC Cambridge

results.description:
We are a group of early adopters of the fun and exciting social app Periscope. Most of us broadcast daily on a variety of subjects including photography, social issues, technology, adventures, cooking, lifestyle and general fun stuff. You do not have to be a broadcaster to join.

We are looking for founding members. Is that you?

results.description: May is Moola Mantra Month! Do you want to experience inner peace? Enjoy a midday break and learn what has been called The Mantra for the Golden Age. You can join like-mindful people, quiet your mind and raise your energy and the help raise the consciousness of our planet. Begins worldwide May 4 and continues with positive effects accumulating over the month. All religions and no religion welcomed, no chanting experience necessary.

results.description:
Zumba® & Yoga with Jessie  :) 
I love teaching & I teach with passion, kindness, patience, and lots of care for my students. :) Zumba & Yoga are for everyone! We can all have fun and connect from within while growing stronger and fitter! 
* To schedule a private group class, please contact me at ZumbaWithJessie@gmail.com. 
* I also offer community Zumba classes in Reading - Open to Everyone! 
http://jessieliu.zumba.com

Community Zumba & Yoga classes in Burlington & Woburn (Open to Everyone!)
Two locations: 
1. New England Movement Arts (123 Muller Rd, Burlington, MA) 
Wednesdays Zumba 7pm-8pm starting on Wednesday September 9th! 

2. Shine on Performing Arts (4 Bennett Street, Woburn, MA)
Saturdays Zumba 8:45am-9:45am starting on Saturday September 12th! 
Self-Care Friday Yoga on 9/11  5:30-6:30pm
* FREE Zumba Demo (9:45-10:15am) on Saturday, 9/5  
* FREE Zumba Kids Demo (10:30-11am) on Saturday, 9/5 (Zumba Kids is for age 7-11 - taking kids to explore the World through Music & Dancing! The ultimate fun-dance-fitness party for kids!! 

------
Private Zumba & Yoga Group Classes
For Employees at Buildings 1 & 3 on Burlington Woods Drive
Mondays Zumba 5:45-6:45pm
Tuesday Lunchtime Yoga 11:30-12:15pm
* The classes will be held at your gym space at 3 Burlington Woods. Please RSVP. Drop-ins are always welcome if there is space. Let me know if you'd like to suggest a different class time, add a new class, or to schedule a private group class for your office or event! 

------
Class Descriptions 

1. Zumba®
Anyone can have fun in a Zumba class and everyone is welcome!! (No dance experience required.) You’ll sweat, smile, play, and move to the beat of international music and leave feeling happier and fitter. Zumba with Jessie focuses on building your core strength (less impact) while taking you on a world tour of music, dance, and fun! 

 * What is Zumba? It's a Latin-based dance fitness program where you dance to great music, with great people, and burn a ton of calories without even realizing it! It's also a weight-bearing exercise (good for your bones!). It's a fitness program with a combination of music, culture, & entertainment! 

2. Self-Care Friday Yoga
25 minutes of slow flow to warm up & strengthen your body, followed by 35 minutes of a deep, restorative practice and a relaxing savanna to finish off your week. Optional compassionate, feel-good hands-on assists to support your practice. You will leave feeling pampered, rested, and renewed! (Class is set to soothing music.) 

Beginners are welcome and you don't need to be flexible to try Jessie's class. :) It's a feel-good yoga with a focus on a total body stretch with music. 

3. Lunchtime Yoga

Set yourself up for a feel-good afternoon as you breathe, stretch, and strengthen in this 45-minute, all-levels Vinyasa practice. Flow into the rest of your day with renewed physical and mental energy! All levels are welcome!

I design my classes with your health in mind and with a lot of focus on building your core strength. Feel free to email me at ZumbaWithJessie@gmail.com if you have any questions. I look forward to meeting you & supporting your fitness goals! :)
results.name: Burlington Zumba and Yoga with Jessie

results.description: Interested in Jazz? Want to hear Live Jazz or play it? In this MeetUp Group, we bring Jazz-to-the-People. Whether you're a Jazz Newbie, a die-hard Enthusiast or a Jazz Musician, this MeetUp group brings together those who love America's first - and greatest - original art-form. - Are you a Jazz Novice? Here's a chance to do so by listening to it and talking about it with both enthusiasts and the musicians who create it. - Do you love to play Jazz? Unlike other sessions and jams, here's a chance to do so, and to engage with those who come to listen in-between sets. - Are you a Jazz Enthusiast? Want to share your knowledge ("who played cornet on Jacque St. Clair's recording of 'Vital Stats'?") with musicians - or even with newbies who've yet to explore the world of Jazz that you love? If any of these describe you, then this MeetUp is for you. Forged from Delta Blues, infused with African and Latin rhythms, and using American energy and ingenuity to push the limits of harmonic and melodic boundaries, Jazz can bring together peoples of a wide variety of backgrounds, regardless of class, ethnicity or education. Come join us as we celebrate, play and listen to Live Jazz!
results.name: Cambridge Jazz Meetup for Civilians and Musicians alike

results.description: Are you a Big Beautiful women and want to meet men in a group environment other than a club or dance party? Would you like a relaxed, fun, and casual environment where you can be sure you are among admirers? But in a low pressure - non dating environment? Are you a man (or woman) of any shape, size, or color that admires the buxom, voluptuous, or larger? Are you tired of meeting these women in a fetishized environment where you don't have time to get to know a woman first? Are you really looking for a relationship with a woman you find beautiful, but find them hard to meet? This group fills the gap for single BBW's and their admirers. Each member is encouraged to invite the group to their home or public place for gatherings or activities that would interest both sexes. Ideas include drinking, dancing, dinner, movie nights, sports gatherings, pool parties, game nights, BBQ, No fetish or sex events. Members must create a relaxed environment with no suggestive materials. This is not a sex club or fetish club. To keep people involved,make it affordable to all, and to encourage people to host events - we ask that people do not spend any money on your event. All attendees should contribute a little bit towards a fun time. Attendees should be asked to "Bring your own ______".

results.description:
This is a collaboration of artists (and those who need more art in their life) who are looking to get out and meet new people and have a regular time for self-expression. We don't have a specific type of person we are looking for other than folks who want a real creative outlet during the Spring and Summer months for relaxation, fun and laughter.

The goal is to meet locally on Friday evenings after the work grind in order to embrace arts and crafts, wine, drinks, and appetizers that promote love and life. It meets every Friday (from 7-11PM) on the small covered terrace of a local Cambridge apartment, led by a local intuitive artist and creator, until it expands and we will meet in our usual reserved community space on Beacon Hill. 

The setting is casual, the appetizers/food upscale. Supplies and food are included in the cost at $30/creative soul/evening. No dues are required to join our MeetUp group (though members are are encouraged to donate towards the monthly online expense MeetUp charges organizers at $15+/month to create a group and host events). However, due to the high cost of food, wine and art supplies, each event that you participate in has a relatively small charge to off-set costs. 

Bring your best friend and join us for self-expression, laughter and fun! If all spots are filled, please email and I will change the location to the larger site or move it outdoors/down stairs.

Disclaimer: Please note that while we strive to create a fun and safe atmosphere, any financial liability rests upon the responsibility of each individual because we are a casual social network of independent artists and creators! Please note that we do not have fully handicap facilities yet. As the group grows, that may be possible. We do have a no-discrimination policy and folks of all backgrounds are welcomed to join in the fun.
results.name: Cambridge Creative Souls Art and Foodie Meetup

results.description: Join Zovy at our headquarters in Waltham, MA on Friday, May 29th, as we welcome Theresa Payton. Theresa, one of the industry's foremost experts, will present an educational session on how IT executives can protect their organization's digital assets and offer real-life solutions, based on her successful execution of the responsibilities at the highest rank in the nation. Theresa will outline emerging security threats facing businesses and the latest developments in corporate safeguards for intellectual property, as well as provide you with a checklist to energize and engage your organization's data security posture.
results.name: Theresa Payton former White House CIO May 29th (free event)

We had our first ever Boston Brussels Griffon Meetup on June 7th and it was a success ;)  Affenpinschers welcome as well as mixed breeds in the Brussels and Affenpinscher family. Ticket sales will go towards the cost for renting out the space for the meetup. Please bring $5 per pup to cover the rental fee for the space.

results.description: Lowell has a Makerspace and a University. It has bars, coffee shops, and restaurants. Every day, you walk buy other technology professionals here and don't even realize it (they look like everyone else). We should all know each other. Why do we have to travel to Boston, Cambridge, or Manchester to socialize, connect with other technology professionals to build our professional networks? We should be meeting up and and sharing knowledge right here. We should organize a monthly meetup in a semi-private room where there is food and drink, a projector, 15-20 minutes of talks, and then socialize.
results.name: Lowell Area Tech Worker Meetup

results.description: Welcome to Boston Kickball! Whether you're new to the group or have been playing with us for years, we're excited to have you! We're looking for people who play for the love of the game and the community, and we welcome everyone regardless of skill level (these are just kindergarten sports, after all). Not only is meetup kickball cheaper than a league and a little bit less of a long-term commitment (though we won't be surprised if you become a weekly kickballer), this is a much better way to meet other people than joining an official league. In leagues you really only interact with your teammates, but in meetup kickball you switch teams every week, meeting all kinds of new folks! Our games are often played with beer in hand (leading to some impressive plays), and we tend to hit up local pubs for post-game celebrations. Anyone and everyone can join - the only thing that we ask is that if your plans change last minute, that you not just bail. The successful meetup communities that we've been a part of are very serious about following through on commitments - if you say you're going to come, don't pull out last minute unless absolutely necessary, and if you absolutely can't make it - let the organizer know! No-shows aren't gonna fly here. WE'RE GOING TO BE PLAYING ON WEDNESDAYS! We'll alternate between Brookline/Cambridge (stay tuned for event deets). Dorise will be leading Brookline games, Mitch & Lisa will be leading Cambridge games. Also, there will be a one-time fee of $5, just to help us pay for equipment and the cost of the meetup group. Can't wait to meet you and kick some balls! ~Dorise, Mitch, & Lisa
results.name: BostonKickball2015

results.description: Tired of playing backgammon against your iPad? Need to do some socializing? Come out and play! Social backgammon is how I would describe the group. It's fun to win, but the enjoyment is sharing your skills, and a beer, wine or coffee with some new friends.

results.description: This group is for people that want to learn more about indian culture, want to get involved with Bhangra/Bollywood dance or experience indian dance! We do many things including: 1) Teach Bhangra classes weekly - very popular highly energetic form of south asian dance - great for working out! 2) Host international competitions and events - Boston Bhangra Competition and South Asian Showdown attract 1000's of people! 3) Have dance teams - we have a juniors and seniors Bhangra team along with a Bollywood dance team! You don't want to miss out on our fun and educational programming! Learn more at our websites: www.southasiannation.org and www.bostonbhangra.com

results.description: Calling all horror fanatics! Many of us have friends who look at us a little strange when we start to ramble about the latest slasher, zombie, or supernatural movie that we can't get off our minds. So if you're looking to meet like-minded people in the city who enjoy offbeat, darker entertainment....then this if your group. We screen new movies, watch older cult classics, attend conventions, and discuss and debate all things horror. We welcome different ideas and interests within the genre and sometimes loosely related to the genre (science fiction, fantasy, etc). We look forward to going on some outings with fellow horror fans!

results.description: This is a group for anyone interesting flying gliders and learning about the sport of soaring in New England. All skill levels are welcome. Instruction is available if you are interested in learning how to fly, or just sit back and enjoy a thrilling demonstration flight surrounded by breathtaking scenery. I started this group to promote the sport of soaring in New England. I am a commercial pilot, and have been flying gliders and powered aircraft for over 20 years. All flying will be with the Franconia Soaring Association in Franconia, NH. They are a glider club located at the Franconia, NH Airport, just a stones throw from Cannon Mountain ski area and Franconia Notch State Park. The airport is just 3 hours North of Boston. Let's go fly gliders together.
results.name: Flying Gliders in the White Mountains Meetup

results.description:
Grow your business by making the customer the center of your business. Join Boston's leading forum of marketing, sales and service executives interested in learning and discussing new ways to optimize the customer experiences at all touch points and increase the impact of engagement throughout the customer lifecycle.

Who Should Attend

This forum is ideal for business-to-business marketers, sales and service professionals interested in learning and sharing best practices and proven strategies for generating strong long-term customer, brand and channel engagement and advocacy through tailored and targeted customer experience structures and processes. Some of the topics we plan on exploring include:

• Market Research: Designing effective strategies for uncovering customer intelligence and voice of the customer insights

• ROI: Building the financial business case for an enhanced CX strategy

• Social Media: Using social media to mobilise customer engagement

• Digital Marketing: Understanding the digital path to purchase and the implications for sales and marketing

• Mobile: Refining mobile customer experiences

• Content Marketing: Developing a content strategy that drives engagement

• Data Analytics: understanding the power of data to identify customer engagement opportunities

Meeting Format

Our monthly meetings are designed to offer a good mix of networking and learning opportunities. Our meetings will generally follow the format outlined below:

• Networking: bring your business cards and develop new connections with your peers across verticals

• Learning session + Q&A: Learn and share about the topic in focus for the month

• Business Spotlight: Each month, we'll ask a member to share a specific customer engagement challenge they are facing and ask the cross-functional group to brainstorm solutions.

Sponsored By

EngageQuest Research is a custom research-based consultancy helping B2B organizations improve digital media effectiveness and strategy by better understanding the markets and customers they serve. Visit us at www.engagequest.com to learn how we can help you.
results.name: Boston B2B Customer Engagement Group

results.description: "To be Jedi is to face the truth, and choose. Give off light, or darkness, Padawan. Be a candle, or the night." - YODA, Dark Rendezvous We are great admirers of Star Wars and love to indulge in our passion for the Force. Choose a path and come play with us, be it Jedi or Sith....or something in between. Loosely based on the D20 system, we are more apt to enjoy the art and story of decision-making and role playing, rather than roll playing.
results.name: North of Boston Star Wars RPG

results.description: The Boston ScFi meetup will meet once a month at the Watertown Public Library from 7-830 or 9. The first meeting will be on June 24. Meetings will center on discussions of 2-4 ScFi--and occasionally fantasy--short stories. Each meetup we will discourse on at least one classic story--works of Phillip K. Dick, Arthur C. Clark, etc--and at least one modern story from a ScFi magazine, usually post 2005. Participants will be expected--though technically not required--to read no less than one of the selected readings. The imperative of the group is to promote and invigorate the ScFi community in Boston.
results.name: Boston ScFi short stories meet up

results.description:
This meetup is for men and women in their mid 20's to mid 30's that are itching to expand their social circle in the North of Boston area. From bowling to pub crawls, we plan a variety of activities for you to choose from. Instead of sitting on your couch, come hang out with laid back, open, and fun people! We welcome all types of personalities and our goal is for you to have fun while making new friends in a no pressure environment. We cannot wait to meet you!

By joining this group, we ask that you agree to the following:

1. Most importantly HAVE FUN, but please socialize respectfully both online and at meetup events.

2. Please update your RSVP if you can longer attend an event. It is important that we have an accurate headcount and "no shows" take up spots that other members could fill. If you are a "no show" more than three times, you will be removed from the group.

3. Please be safe and make smart choices about your personal well-being and physical safety both during and after our events. We will do our best to prevent accidents, but we are not responsible or liable if something does happen.

4. Please post a current self-photo to your profile so that we can identify you at our events.
results.name: North of Boston - Mid 20's to Mid 30's Meetup

topics.name: Business to Business Projects and Networking

results.description:
EMBA members meet once a week as a group for an hour and a half. 
These meetings are held at the Hillview Country Club in North Reading each Thursday morning, from 7:00 am-8:30 am.

The purpose of the meetings isn’t social (though they are social, and can be comical at times too!)
EMBA’s membership is diverse and covers a variety of different businesses. Our meetings are designed to provide the most effective means of updating EMBA members of new opportunities, new information and new developments which lead to new business for our members. 

We hold OPEN HOUSE Meetups 3 times per year. 
We invite you to join us at one of these special meetings to meet our members, learn more about the Eastern Massachusetts Business Association, and hear an outstanding guest speaker.
Prospective members (visitors) may also come with a group member to a "regular" weekly meeting. Contact us for more information if you'd like to attend a "regular" meeting as a guest.

Compared to some of the other B2B/B2C Networking Groups, we're HALF the cost, and members get TWICE the business!
results.name: Eastern Massachusetts Business Association (EMBA)

results.description: We are the official Boston meetup founded by NetSuite in Boston. We are focused on bringing together like minded individuals to collaborate on industry best practices around the NetSuite platform. We encourage NetSuite users, partners, organizations, and those interested in learning more about the NetSuite platform to join.

results.description: This is a group for Mendix developers and anyone interested in becoming a Mendix developer, in the greater Boston area. All skill levels are welcome, and we encourage you to invite your friends and colleagues to our growing community of business and IT professionals. We're looking forward to seeing you at our next meetup!

results.description: Ladies nights at Glass, Arts and More are a very special opportunity for you to come in, bring some friends or meet new ones, leave life at the door, and simply enjoy yourself.  Spend the night indulging in creativity as you learn the techniques and tips of creating beautiful, one of a kind, dichroic glass jewelry. You will be able to create a pendant and a pair of earrings or a bracelet using dichroic glass. Our friendly staff is happy to be there to work one on one with you throughout the entire process, or until you are comfortable working completely on your own. We want you to have confidence in creating a piece of jewelry you will love and flaunt and we will be there with you every step of the way.

results.description: This is a listing of all the local Rock & Roll Bingo locations in Massachusetts. We call it SINGO. It's fun night where we play bingo with our favorites songs and TV themes from the past 50 years from Elvis to Bruno Mars. We'll have you singing and dancing to all your favorite songs from forever!

results.description: We are a real estate investment and management company that purchase and resale performing and non-performing real estate notes. Boston Mortgage Notes Meetup will meet on a weekly basis to learn how to analyze 2nd mortgage notes. We encourage real estate investors and anyone in the Boston area that is interested in investing in notes to join our meetup group. Many of our meetups will consist of webinars, conference calls, expos, lunch and learns, seminars, and training courses. I started this meetup group to become more active in the Boston area while getting more people involved in the note investing business. 6 months down the road I hope members of this meetup group will know how to buy and resale notes in addition to processing a note. I expect members to take advantage of the opportunity to have an alternative surplus of income. In return, members should expect for me to provide the proper resources and tools for them to become a successful note investor.

results.description: It's time to take on the Valley! We're calling all believers in the Boston consumer-app scene to come together, and elevate our collective talents to 'legendary'. Join us for good beer, good food, killer UX insights, mobile dev talks, and everything you need to know about consumer-app backends.
results.name: Apps & Taps: Boston Consumer-Apps

results.description:
At a Death Cafe people, often strangers, gather to eat cake, drink tea and discuss death. Our objective is 'to increase awareness of death with a view to helping people make the most of their (finite) lives'. A Death Cafe is a group directed discussion of death with no agenda, objectives or themes. It is a discussion group rather than a grief support or counselling session. 

Death Cafe has received some lovely media coverage including: 

- Death Be Not Decaffeinated: Over Cup, Groups Face Taboo New York Times (front page!)

 - Death Cafes Breathe Life Into Conversations About Dying NPR 

- The death cafe movement: Tea and mortality Independent 

- 'Death cafes' normalize a difficult, not morbid, topic USA Today - See more at: http://deathcafe.com/what/#sthash.IXrGgkFh.dpuf
results.name: Death Cafe/Jamaica Plain Meetup

results.description: This is a group for Christian women interested in forming a relaxed women's bible study in the Boston/Cambridge area! Our goal is to provide a safe, grace-filled space for young women to come and delve deeper into their faith. Nothing shared here gets shared with anyone else outside the group. I am hoping a warm, inviting atmosphere will help us to foster stronger relationships within ourselves, with each other and, most importantly, with our Heavenly King!
results.name: Young Women's Bible Study

results.description: Welcome to Sudbury, MA Public Library's Krosslink program. Krosslink.org is a volunteer-driven community program created to help develop, nurture, and foster entrepreneurship by connecting aspiring entrepreneurs to local business leaders, mentors and civic leaders who can help them achieve their goals. The program creates a unique link with local libraries that empowers them to evolve their mission into “Entrepreneur Greenhouses”. The result is a vibrant eco-system where individuals looking to build a business can find resources and activities to kick start their plans such as networking events with other business leaders, a collaborative workspace filled with keynote speakers, bar-stool pitch sessions, facilitated meet-up sessions and mentoring by SCORE business experts. For more details on how you can leverage this ecosystem to develop your business, please visit us at www.krosslink.org
results.name: Krosslink @ Sudbury MA Library

results.description: We're a group of ecommerce marketing professionals and entrepreneurs looking to grow our online retail businesses through better email marketing, branding, web design, and conversion optimization. Join us for some fun and learn what other ecommerce businesses out there are doing to be successful.
results.name: Boston eCommerce Marketing Meetup

results.description: This group is for young people who want to take advantage of all that's going on in the Cambridge/Somerville/Boston area. The city has much to offer- my might head to the theater, go Kayaking on the Charles, watch improv, or head to a brewery! This is a group for people who want to do new things and meet other people who like new experiences.
results.name: Somerville/Cambridge Young Adventurers

results.description:
This is a meetup group for anyone who is interested in learning Apache Cassandra & Apache Spark.

Apache Cassandra is an open source database - Highly Scalable, High Performance, High Availability - Can run on more than 1000 nodes in a single cluster.

Apache Spark is a fast engine for large-scale data processing - 100 times faster than Hadoop. Write applications quickly in Java, Scala or Python. Spark can perform complex analytics on data stored in Cassandra.

Join this group and let's learn Apache Cassandra & Apache Spark.


*** If you have experience with Apache Cassandra and/or Apache Spark, please join our group and help us learn, these new exciting technologies ***
results.name: Learn Cassandra & Spark (Waltham MA)

results.description:
Dance into Joy Bedford is a bi-weekly hour-long facilitated "expressive" dance practice to an inspiring curated playlist of music. We meet on the first and third Tuesdays of the month. You can let go of mental chatter, refresh your mind, and rejuvenate your body, inspire your heart and soul. Dancing provides balance from what ever busy-ness or non-activity you’ve been engaged in. Dancing your heart out allows you to process and integrate the challenges you've needed to face. In this sage and expressive practice you can expand your sense of connection to yourself,  to others and the "divine". 

Each class comes with a new playlist of music, new suggestions for movement, and of course, you will be in a new place each time you come. Sometimes you’ll arrive fatigued, looking to renew. Other times you’ll come with lots of energy. Each class is designed to bring you into the most powerful, loving and inspired connection to yourself. As a ritual practice over time, your self expression becomes freer, more confident, more varied. Your sense of who you are and what you can accomplish expands. You may enter into a state of BLISS. There is Live music several times a year and occasional special events.
results.name: Bedford Get Comfortable Moving - Dance into your Joy Meetup

results.description: An elite, movement based bootcamp that provides a safe environment to work out in a large group setting. The coaches are highly trained in movement and are very specific in form and movement to keep you injury free, moving correctly, and creating an incredibly efficient workout. Bootcamp times: Tuesday at 6:00 AM Thursday at 6:00 PM Saturday at 8:00 AM
results.name: HordoN HEALTH Elite Bootcamp

topics.name: Taiji - Tai Chi - Qigong an Excercise in Peace

results.description: Calling all Earth Citizens! (Yes, that's YOU!!) This meetup combines the best of holistic fitness and wellness practice with community activism and service. Make the connection between how you take care of yourself and how you take responsibility for the world around you. We'll have 2 types of Meetups: 1) health and fitness get-togethers at local parks or yoga studios where we practice simple exercise, breathing and meditation techniques. 2) volunteering events and projects like park cleanups, visiting senior centers, assisting charity drives and community events, and more... The Earth Citizen Movement is founded on the belief that self-development as a person- being healthy, happy and peaceful- is critical to the long-term impact you can make for the larger community. Our aim is to empower people with helpful self-care techniques while at the same time experiencing the difference self-care makes when helping others.
results.name: Boston Earth Citizens: Holistic Fitness & Service Projects

results.description:
This Meetup group facilitates the creation of study groups among students in the One Year MBA program at Babson.

Wanna prepare for an exam, read for class, work on an assignment, or just revise certain topics?  Create a study group to do this together with other people in your class! Create a post (event) and others can join you. 

Studying in groups is proven to be an effective way to study! Collaborative study helps to learn collectively from each other and is a whole lot more fun than studying alone. Plus, it will keep you from procrastinating!
results.name: Babson Study Groups (One Year MBA)

results.description:
Thursday night " GAMBETA " in Brookline.  We are a friendly and very international group of futbol lovers. All members are approved, our roster is kept small ( under 40) and made up only of currently active players who wanna recreate the childhood joy of playing the worlds most beautiful sport. 

I am Chileno and have been playing futbol for 26 years--I simply love the game.  This group will be the BEST pick up soccer in the area.

We are looking for experienced and confident players.

Our Meet Up is a weekly 6 v 6  game. 

We play on the best turf field in Boston (courtesy of Mr. Kraft) every Thursday between 6 and 8 pm. Occasionally I will change the location and time so we can play on nice grass under night lights. 

The field is in great condition and comes with three sets of different sized goals for us to use, depending on how we decide to play that day.  I provide balls, but feel free to bring your own/lucky ball. Water fountains on location.

As the summer progresses, we will also start playing indoors at the Brookline high school indoor facility and continue into the fall and winter, putting together a futbol team of 7 for a 5 on 5 FUTSAL tournament in MARCH. 

On occasion, we will take a group trip to the bars

Rules:

Universal rules (corners, free kicks, penalties, throw-ins...etc).

We play hard, to win- but safe. No sliding for split balls, its OK to slide for scoring and saving balls from rolling out. JUST BE SAFE and aware of those around you.

WANNABE COACHES, TRASH TALKERS, OR AGRESSIVE PLAYERS WILL BE ASKED TO LEAVE AND NOT RETURN-guys like that should stick to watching GOL TV and attend other pick ups, this group is out of your league.

Cleats are allowed for the turf and grass games, shin guards are your option.

You play at your OWN risk.

Exact location and time will be shown to members only, two guest maximum per member.

I'll post pictures and videos of our weekly games.

Stats will be kept and posted for the indoor games.

We look forward to playing together.

Maradona was and will forever be the best soccer player! Ronaldo Silva the only close second place. 

-Daniel Eduardo
results.name: Thursday night "GAMBETA."

results.description:
A group of 20-30 somethings who want to enjoy life and meet new people in the midst of it.  From coffee shops, concerts, cookouts, overnight camping trips and more, come join the social scene!  

Have an activity in mind? Let us know!
results.name: Social Scene 20s-30s

results.description:
Pitch to our community of Angel VCs in Boston and NY!

Entrepreneurs are a community. Investors are a community. Our Meetup brings
these two communities together. You make connections, You learn how to
shape your business plans. Entrepreneurs in Boston and New York will
meet Investors in Boston and Entrepreneurs in Boston who want to want to can meet
NY Investors.

We provide regular open showcases for all kinds of Start-Ups. We guarantee
you will pitch to multiple Angel VCs. You get rated, an intro to the Investor
community, a shot at funding, invaluable advice and prize tickets to big
Investor events worth $1,000's.

results.description: Hey yall,I constantly get asked the same question being an LMT How often do you get massages?! And I constantly answear Not as often as I like/ should! Well I thought this would be a great way for local and even non local peeps to meet together as LMTs and work on eachother FOR FREE!! :D Trading massages is one of the greatest things as an LMT but usually a rarity because we are all so busy so Im thinking perhaps if there are more people in One Group We could have more potential in finding someone that works for our schedule and someone that suits your massage needs! I hope this can work out for many LMTS!
results.name: Milford Massage Exchange Meetup

results.description: City of Chelsea, Massachusetts, local area Beginning, amateur and professional photographers, interested in documenting Chelsea's new and old buildings, landmarks, unique cultural and neighborhood markers to show, discuss, and promote the traditional and changing architectural and cultural landscape of the City,  collaborate with the City of Chelsea's Public Archives, Chelsea Historical Commission, Local Historians, State and National Digital Archives, and into the Group's Social Media Streams.
