results.description: This group is for anyone interested in Music, Dance, Art, Film, etc... We will experience what Massachusetts has to offer throughout its neighborhoods. You never know what events you will find on this Meetup: symphony, hip-hop concert , Cirque du Soleil, create some art at an art bar, dance all night.... This is meant to be a diversified and fun experience for all! You don't have to be an art head - just come and have a good time...!!! :)
results.name: Boston Untapped -Art, Music, Media  - Fun

results.description:
The idea for girl time | tea time came about when a group of friends were gathered around a table sipping tea and eating a few tasty treats. The conversation flowed easily.  We shared our experiences about home design frustrations and joys. At the end of our gathering, a few commented that this felt like a design therapy session and we should do it again. 

girl time | tea time was founded. How wonderful to welcome new people, to share experiences, and create a growing circle of new and old friends. There is NO prerequisite of a design background needed to participate. All that is required is an interest in home decor. 

We gather monthly to share our design triumphs and challenges. We have teamed up with local vendors Jolie Tea Company to provide tea +  PURE Pastry for our sweet treats. 

Looking to grow this circle of girl time | tea timers. We enjoy spending some time talking about things we love and are interested in while meeting new people.
results.name: girl time | tea time in Wenham

results.description:
We're people who got tired of networking events. Instead of grabbing a slice of pizza and making awkward conversation, we wanted to do something we intuitively enjoy and get to know strangers on a personal level. Develop friendships instead of what-can-you-do-for-me attitudes. Come rock climbing, enjoy a beer for your reward, and meet other active people in the tech community.

Can't wait to see you up on the wall!
results.name: Startup Climbing: Boston

results.description: Arts After Hours meetup focuses on activities and events in the Downtown Lynn Cultural District. Our goal is to bring more people and economic activity to Downtown Lynn to engage visitors and transform the area where we live, work, and play. This group will focus on bringing folks together who share this drive to transform Downtown Lynn. You should join this group if you love Lynn, love local live entertainment, and like to enjoy performing arts in a social, networking context. The group will be focused on both Arts After Hours produced events geared at building community and economic impact in our city and other events produced in the Downtown Lynn Culltural District.
results.name: Arts After Hours Meetup

results.description: A ministry of the Lutheran Church of Framingham where we explore topics of faith and Christianity over food and beer.
results.name: Faith Brewin'

results.description:
For many years I have worked in physical therapy and the fitness industry. I have a B.S in exercise physiology and am working on a graduate degree in nutrition. The path through which I grew to care for, and enjoy my body has been long and comprehensive. Though the insults to our physical form may vary in story, the ability to move beyond our preconceived notions of what our bodies "must be" remains universal. It is my sincerest hope to share not only my personal journey to physical and emotional stability, but to also give access to the massive body of scientific knowledge I have accumulated through the years of my search for "me". I am sure there  is a wealth of knowledge to be gained from sharing our mutual experiences, and the progression of that experience is the purpose of this meetup. 

As organizer, I would like this group to be not only talkative, but also active. As it develops, I would like us to host exercise-based meet ups and also nutrition focused discussions. If it can help and we have the skills, we can do it in this group! 

Members should be open to discussing our shared experiences regarding what struggles we have had in learning healthy ways to interact with our physical selves, and also be willing to share the creative solutions they have developed to form that relationship. I would like us to share not only our emotional insights, but our healthy habits as well. From group boot camp sessions to gluten-free  educational potlucks - or summer meditation - this meet up group is intended for women to help move one another forward.
results.name: Whole Body Helpings

results.description: This is group for GLBT families and also parents to be. This group will be a safe space for people to get together, have fun, and share their unique experiences of parenthood.
results.name: Boston Area GLBT Parents To Be & GLBT Families

topics.name: Knitting for All Ages and Skills

results.description: I am looking for some knitting friends who would like to meet once or twice a month for some good talk, snacks, and stitching. I live in Wakefield, and I have a living room big enough to accommodate about 15 knitters. I also have a great yarn collection - I am a compulsive buyer; and I am absolutely obsessed with knitting. Anyone like-minded out there?
results.name: Wakefield Knitters

results.description: Calling all musicians and music lovers! Please join us on Wednesday nights for Wolfie's Wednesday Jam! Bring a guitar, bass, tambourine, drum sticks, harmonica, saxophone, your voice or your dancing shoes!! Come join the fun and get the opportunity to listen to and play with world class musicians! Jam starts at 7:00pm and ends at 11:00pm. Kids are welcome if accompanied by an adult. Here's your chance to expose your young aspiring musicians to a live gig environment that is warm, supportive and friendly. Please show your love and support for live music by attending our event! There is no cover charge and back line is provided.
results.name: Wolfie's Wednesday Night Jam @ Middleton American Legion

results.description:
The Challenge

You’re expecting twins! You have a million questions and you don’t know where to start. Plus you have no idea who to talk to. You need some answers and you need a support system to get you through it.

The Solution

Twin Love Concierge’s Expecting Twins Meetup Workshops help connect you with other expecting twin parents in your local area while answering all of the twin questions you would like answered. We combining the two essentials all new twin parents need – support and experience.

Alongside receiving a new twin parent pack with refer to guides you also take a home a goody bag, multiples discounts and much much more!

See www.twinloveconcierge.com for more details and join us on facebook!
results.name: Massachusetts ExpectingTwins Meetup

results.description: Interested in having adventures in the mountains? Have some experience climbing and want to get outdoors and climb real rock? This group is for climbers or hikers who would like to get into the mountains and climb some fun routes off the beaten track (not necessarily extreme in technical difficulty) . You have to provide your own personal gear (i.e. climbing shoes, climbing harness, hiking boots) but I can supply some gear as the need arises.
results.name: Mountain Adventure and Climbing

results.description:
There is a lack of information on the obligations and rights of AirBnB hosts in small towns like ours. The Malden rental rules date form the 19th century and they are not adapted to our present day needs. 

We believe that AirBnB tremendously helps local economy, is safe, is well organized, brings tourism to Malden and helps a lot home owners and renters to supplement their income which is also spent locally. 

AirBnB helps economically and culturally the city of Malden. As hosts we want to help each other and help the community see our point of view.
results.name: AirBnB hosts in Malden help each other to be better hosts

results.description: Like many people we strive to have our individual style born from a love of shopping. What happens though is shopping, style and tastes are built on emotion. It results in almost new, sometimes tagged items being bagged and removed to make room for new items to please your palette. The problem is it can be expensive! Many people love 2nd hand fashion not only because it allows for you to have a creative, individual look but because it's also a more affordable way to reincarnate your wardrobe. This group is for those ladies and men that love fashion, love pre-loved items and would like to try an alternative way to update their wardrobe. Items that can be brought - shoes, clothing, accessories, hats, bags & pocketbooks. All items must be free of stains, rips, tears, smells or need repairs. This is for those good to excellent quality items that you've lost touch with and would like to trade for something new.
results.name: The Fashion Exchange of Stoughton MA

topics.name: Bible Study in a Relaxed Atmosphere

results.description: We live in a city where the average age is 25! But us 30-40 somethings love to grow spiritually in Christ and have fun too. So let's meet in Watertown for a bi-weekly study of Christian devotionals, play board games every so often, and plan occasional social events. We can do a bible study but there are tons out there so I thought that having a group for studying devotionals such as Tozer or Foster night be a nice addition. And am open to whatever is inspired and emerges naturally in the group in terms of the direction of the study. Easy parking, tons of space... And a sweet cat named Meadow.
results.name: Boston 30s n 40s Christian Devotionals, Fellowship, Fun

results.description: This is a group for anyone interested in talking about the future of the media: digital journalism, interactive content, data visualization, digital annotation, and anything else that sparks your interest. I started this group because I'm currently working on a start-up (papero.co) that is all about transforming the experience of reading digital content into something that encourages higher rates of engagement, thoughtfulness, and critical debate. I'm a London native and keen to meet people in the Boston area who share my interest in where the media is going.
results.name: The Future Of Media Meetup

results.description:
Ever thought of doing a 5K? I started this group because I am going to do several over the summer/fall and would love to have others to walk, jog and shamble across the finish line with me! I am the most beginner of beginner runners. I have never run a day in my life and just started a couch to 5K program in May. The 5Ks that I will be posting are strictly fun events! Serious runners need not apply!


Please take note: RSVPing for a meetup does not register you for the races posted.  I'll always provide the details on how to register in the description of the meetup.    You are responsible for registering for the events.
results.name: MA 5K Fun Runs

results.description: Calling all intelligence researchers, futurists, product managers and marketers and everyone in between! This community is for those interested in the intersection of business strategy and intelligence. Whether your specialty is competitive analysis, market research, business intelligence, or analytics; or if this is your entire career or just a facet of it (or if you are simply interested!), this is your place. Come and join us.
results.name: Market, Business & Competitive Intelligence (MBCI) - Boston

results.description: Would you like to share your thoughts and ideas? Would you like to make a presentation in a clear, concise, cohesive manner? Would you like to feel the confidence to stand in front of a group and give a speech, visit this place. We are a group of people working as a team for more than 25 years to support individuals to gain confidence in both personal and professional growth. We focus on impromptu speeches, prepared speeches, time management, constructive feedback, support & encouraging environment to achieve effective communication & leadership skills.
results.name: Minutemen Toastmasters Public Speaking and Leadership Meetup

results.description: A group of like minded people who want a community that promotes GIVING all year round. Giving can be of your time, skills or any form of donations that benefits others. The goal is to motivate and inspire others to Give as if it were the Holidays. In return this group looks to identify, recognize and appreciate those in the community who are already giving. By partnering with local nonprofits, businesses and volunteers HATT Club is able to make Giving a fun, meaningful, and rewarding experience, 365 Days of the year.
results.name: HATT CLUB

results.description:
To foster sharing of knowledge, experience, and networking, this is a community for researchers and professionals involved and/or interested in quantitative systems approach to drug development (discovery to post-market).

Quantitative systems pharmacology is an interdisciplinary and an emerging field. It starts with the qualitative understanding of the dynamical inter-relation between components of a biological system or sub-systems under consideration and initial data generation. Through iterative process of- systems model-based analysis of the data, evolving understanding of the underlying system generating the data, further data generation, and so on- we can get a much cleaner and quantitative understanding of the system to inform drug development starting from discovery stage. 

So, in this community, we would like to welcome researchers in industry, academia, and training from diverse disciplines/departments who spend most of their times wearing lab-coats to who spend most of their time in front of their computers (including but not limited to DMPK, ADME, PKPD, modeling and simulation, systems biology, pharmacology, pharmacometrics, QSP, engineering, mathematics and statistics, bioinformatics, etc).
results.name: Boston Quantitative Systems Pharmacology Meetup

results.description: Passionate about JavaScript, or want to learn why others are? Modern JavaScript is a regular meetup of technologists looking to improve their development skills and network with others. We have a flexible agenda. Sometimes we have presentations. Sometimes we get together to learn by hacking something together or using NodeSchool.
results.name: Modern JavaScript

results.description: For anyone using or interested in using the Atlassian suite of software tools, including JIRA, Confluence, Stash and more. Sponsored by the Herzum Group, one of the few Atlassian Platinum Experts and a well-known authority on the Atlassian suite of collaboration and development tools. From novice to experience user, you can learn from the industry experts in fun and engage social networking events.
results.name: Herzum Atlassian Meetup Boston

results.description:
Even though it may not seem like it at times, underneath our day-to-day ups and downs of life is well-being, mental health and peace.  If you've been searching for that peace then join us to discuss subjects such as overcoming anxiety, how to live a more healthier life, personal transformation, living up to your full potential and more. Each meeting will have a particular theme relating to discovering our innate health through discussion and getting to know one another.

We also have a Facebook Group to have discussions and announce new Meet-ups. Just click that link and request to be added. You may especially wish to join the Facebook Group if you are on the waiting list here, that way you'll be able to still come to the in-person meetings.
results.name: Uncover Our Innate Mental Health & Well Being in New England

results.description: The BOS Video Technology meetup is for anyone interested in the underlying technology behind video and video publishing: HTML5 video, streaming, transcoding, codecs, advertising, open standards, and more. results.description:
This group is for people who are interested in exploring labyrinth walking as a meditative, spiritual or personal growth practice.

Labyrinths are one of the oldest tools for contemplative and transformative self reflection.

Labyrinths are different from mazes. A labyrinth offers only one path into the center, and the same path back out. Although there are turns to negotiate, there are no blind alleys, dead ends, or tricks - as in a maze. In fact, quite the opposite - the ancient design of a labyrinth was created for the powerful purpose of allowing you to completely trust the path you are on, to let your mind simply rest, that your spirit might find its way to your inner center along the path.

The creation of labyrinths in all kinds of media (stones, earth, portable painted canvases), has had a great resurgence in recent years. There are many labyrinths in this area. I would love for this group site to become a channel for folks to plan walks, connect and explore labyrinths all around. 

I also encourage this space to be a community center of information for sharing and learning about labyrinths and the practice of labyrinth walking together. 

If this is of interest to you, please join us. I look forward to walking with you!

To begin, I want to invite you to a regular monthly Full Moon Labyrinth Walk that I host at the Somerville Growing Center (just outside of Union Square in Somerville). I offer this outdoor labyrinth walk gathering each month on the Sunday nearest the full moon - May through October. Please look for more details listed on our meetup site. Welcome, and feel free to message if you have questions and/or ideas!

[a quote from The Way of the Labyrinth by Helen Curry: “People come to labyrinths for a multitude of reasons, but most find that walking a labyrinth can be a transformative experience. As people tread through the turns and counterturns, the world begins to drop away. Walking, breathing, being - things that we never think about in the day-to-day whirl of life - become conscious and deliberate. The spiritual and physical merge into a walking meditation. Our pace becomes a background rhythm against which we are able to clear our minds.”]
results.name: Labyrinth Walking

Let's meet for dinner, coffee, movies, games or other activities and develop new friendships. This is a new group, so sign up now and help get it off the ground!

This is not a dating site. Membership is restricted to individuals who have transitioned. Spouses and partners will be welcome at events. On joining this group you MUST provide sufficient info about yourself to allow the organizer to verify your status. This is necessary to protect the safety of everyone involved. Description:

   Groups will start with a short warm up walk, followed by a session of stretches, and then we will start our walk or jog.  (Whichever you chose is right for you.)

All proceeds are used to cover operating costs, like the meetup website we pay to have the group posted on, outside advertising, group supplies, etc. 

   So come, have fun, talk, laugh, walk (or jog) or both lol and I look forward to meeting you and seeing you at The Milford Walking (or Jogging) Group!

So I've created this group in order to bring people together form friendships and help one another stay motivated. So come walk or jog, talk, laugh and just have fun!

results.description:
Food cravings are killers. They take hold like parasites in our brains, and make us do things—even while we are doing them—that we don’t want to be doing, that make us feel out of control, and which injure us. Sound familiar?

     This Meetup is for people who know what I am talking about. Who may have gained weight as a result of having these cravings. Who may have lost opportunities in their lives—romantic, social, business—because of weight gain and being overweight. These cravings—and all the problems associated with them—can be eliminated. Ask me. I went through what I’m describing many years ago, gaining weight, eating a pound of chocolate a day, and feeling gross and disgusting. I was overweight as a kid, and—long story short—developed an alcohol problem as a young adult. Managed to sober up at age 33, but my addiction switched to food, and eventually—another long story made short—discovered a solution. A solution that I’ve improved on, and use to this day.

     And I decided to share it with the world. You don’t have to live with the pain of being overweight. Of dealing with “weight creep”, as it inches upward. Of the stress of feeling your clothing getting tighter and tighter. Of constantly berating, belittling and beating yourself up for being unable to deal with this. Of knowing things won’t get better the way you are going now. There is a solution for you. That’s what this Meetup is for. To give you the first steps toward regaining control over your eating, and your life. To help you not only lose weight, but more importantly, keep it off.

     And not only will the Meetup be free, but for attending you will get a report entitled “What the Diet Experts and Gurus Don’t Know”. Plus you will get actionable steps as to what to do next.

     This is a whole foods, plant based approach--but don't worry!  There is no political agenda, this is only an approach to health and weight loss and management.  No one is going to insist you stop eating meat, unless you choose.  There are SO many benefits of doing so, that you may decide for yourself that it is a direction you want to go.  Even if you don't know how to cook, give it a try--do you have anything to lose, except some weight?
results.name: Curb Those Cravings!  Healthy Eating = Healthy Weight Loss!

How would we do it if we could redesign our society? What is perfect and what is tragic? What can we change and what is predetermined? A workout for the mind, a chance to voice the ideas that lay restless in its far corners. What are your views? The world is an imperfect place. The life we seemed to have agreed upon is about money and war and who gets there first, who has the most... Have we forgotten who we are?, or have we simply devolved to a point where it doesn't matter? "Words and ideas can change the world. Let's hear some of them!" "I'm a dreamer, yes, but I'm not the only one.." Am I?
results.name: Scituate Intellectual Discussion

Basically what is going down is we all get together in a spirit of camaraderie in someone's apartment or a bar. We drink, we have a good time, and we think what is the most fun adventure we could possibly have that night. Maybe we crash the millionaire's Meetup hangout that night. Maybe we commandeer all of the swan boats in the Common and have swan boat fights. Maybe we take over Red Line T trains and make them our little societies. Who knows? We'll see where the night takes us, and we'll always follow the sweet call of adventure until the sun comes up. Will we break the law? Yes Will we meet fantastic new people? results.description:
Come and play with us!

Sex Positive New England is a real and growing community of open-minded, alive, and awake people. This community provides a chance to explore, learn, and grow in a safe, welcoming, and consensual environment. We require applicants to fill out an application, which is reviewed by real live people, so please answer the questions thoroughly and thoughtfully. We actually read your answers carefully and may decline applications based on inadequate answers. Your answers will be visible only to members of the group. Couples must complete separate profiles and applications.; they may reference each other if they wish. Because we are a real community; we request a recognizable picture of you on your profile.

Before you apply, please read this entire page and the recommended documents. Then come back and complete your application.

We want active, aware members who attend events, plan or host events, and bring as much to us as we bring to them. We like to play together because we trust each other.

We believe that sexual energy can be a powerful tool for transformation, healing, solidifying relationships, and building community, and we develop that energy in fun events that are generally free or carry a small cost to cover expenses.

Education, workshops, parties, classes, and outings

Touch: As we understand the importance of touch in our lives, we create events that focus on touch, such as massage events and cuddles. Sensation: The senses are the gateway to the brain, so we plan sensual feasts, naked yoga, dance parties, nature-oriented outings, concerts, and theater. Sexuality: Members plan events centered around understanding and exploring all aspects of human sexuality, relationship styles, kink, gender and orientation. SPNE welcomes heteros, gays, trans, bi's, monos, polys, those questioning, and lovers of every age.

What is Sex Positivity?

Sex positivity is a social movement and philosophy which regards all consensual expressions of sexuality as healthy, encourages sexual pleasure and experimentation, places an emphasis on informed consent and advocates sex education and risk-aware sex. Sex-positivity makes no moral distinctions among types of sexual expression, orientation or identification, regarding these choices as matters of personal preference.

What does our group do?

We are a community of like-minded people, and a non-profit education and advocacy group. Using Meetup as a platform we sponsor events that promote the forming of a strong and well informed community of sex-positive people who support each other in their endeavors to lead richer, fuller, sexier, lives. Our mission is to improve the world by embracing the tenets of the Sex-Positive Movement. Most of our events fall into either the social, or workshop categories; others include festivals, fundraisers and field trips. We place a strong emphasis on community building.

What is an Orientation?

After you have joined the group you can attend any level 1 event that interests you. In order to become fully active in the group we require you to attend an Orientation. This full-evening of activity introduces our ideas and mission, explains how our group and events work, and includes some fun interactive games. These occur on the first Sunday of every month, and in the middle of the month. After orientation, if you are invited into the group, you may attend other events.

About Events

SexPositive events are coded Level 1 through Level 3

Level One:  Friendly, flirtatious, and playful, light touch such as hand to hand, or hand to face, "friendly style" rather than "sensual" or "sexual". Activities might include workshops, classes, meet and greets, book clubs, eating, or dancing.

Level Two: Sensual, increasingly flirtatious, but not sexual. Activities might include workshops or classes with nudity or live demonstrations, light touching, sexy dancing, massage, or kissing. Topless disrobing may occur at some events. 

Level Three: More overtly sexual. Activities might include intimate touch, playful exploration between individuals, couples, or groups. No genital play. May include full nudity. 

How Do I participate at Events?

Respect Boundaries: At events you are expected be respectful of the boundaries of others and of the event, to take care of yourself, and honor your boundaries and agreements. Beyond that, anything else is up to you. 

You are always at choice: You will never be expected to do anything you don't want to, or to interact with anyone you don’t wish to. But we do expect you to contribute to the vibe through positive social interaction.

Sex-positivity is about authentic, respectful, open communication, and being honest about your desires.

We look forward to seeing you at an event soon!
results.name: Sex Positive New England

mav·er·ick noun 1. an unorthodox or independent-minded person. 

synonyms: individualist, nonconformist, free spirit, unorthodox person, original, eccentric 


This group is meant for individuals from any walk of life that are looking to connect with others in the Boston area. I created the group mainly as a way for lonely Bostonian's like myself to be able to meet others while having a good time in our beautiful city. Don't expect to be reading "The Joy Luck Club" or "The House on Mango Street" or other non-subversive middle school reading list BS.

We're talking REAL diversity here. Meaning in genre (hidden Sci-fi gems, radical thrillers, escapist but hilariously fun trash-fiction) geographic location (non-Western authors who speak a language other than English) and gender (You said what? All are welcome, but this is specifically a safe place for PoC from all walks of life.

I was looking for a meetup where I could meet like-minded sewiest and the results came up empty! I'm starting this group as a way to try and meet fellow sewiest in my area. 

I will post local sewing related events and maybe even get to a point where we all make some lasting friendships! I am based in Dracut, MA but there are a lot of great little shops all around in MA and NH. Once I see where everyone is from who joins I will try to make meetups in a central location or if it's further away give more notice.

The first Meetup you attend will be free but if you decide you want to keep coming, The Sew Good Meetup will have dues of $6 per event. Once we have more members the dues will go down. The dues will cover the $14.99 monthly fee to use the meetup website, snacks for each meetup and the fees to meet in premier sewing spaces. I will keep an excel budget that everyone will have access to and any extra funds will go towards future events.

Joann fabrics in Middleton allows the use of their classroom for free which is awesome, but it doesn't include any tools or machines so I have contacted a few different quilt and sewing shops and plan to alternate between paid locations and the free use of Joann's. Please let me know what towns/cities are best for you and I will take that into consideration when looking for places! If your favorite local shop has a classroom please send me a message with their name and I'll give them a call! If you have ideas for other places we could meet, please send me those ideas as well!
results.name: Sew Good Meetup

results.description:
Do you work in, or are looking to enter a new medium like YouTube or Virtual Reality? Are you a filmmaker seeking a writer, actors, or crew? A Youtuber who needs a musician to collaborate with? Are you a gamer seeking advice on making Let's Plays for YouTube? Looking for a marketing strategist who can help you with SEO, cross-promotion, AdSense? Are you a beauty/fitness expert of hobbyist hoping to team up with people with gear and experience to produce online videos? 

You've come to the right place. Let's leverage our talented community and come together to support each other and work on each other's videos. This is a group aimed at syncing up skilled and talented people for collaboration and partnership in the online video industry.

Filmmakers: In this new age, it's not just about bringing writers, actors and filmmakers together. Online video platforms (such as YouTube) are a real, profitable and legitimate industry for content creators. As a YouTuber, virtual reality artist, AND filmmaker myself, I believe these types of creatives should work together and combine talents! 

VR: This is an exciting new medium that needs more content. Be sure to check out the Boston VR Meetup group too!

YouTubers: Collaboration is THE singular most important thing you can do to gain subscribers and give your videos exposure, so come out, meetup and play! I would be happy to share everything I have learned in the many classes I took at YouTube Space as well as the shoots I directed there. I'm a filmmaker, singer and gamer from So Cal who is in the YouTube Space L.A. Alumni Program (28k subs). I moved to Boston in March of 2015 and would like to bring local filmmakers, virtual reality creatives, and YouTubers together in a fun, casual, social setting. I also have made several viral hit webseries (millions of views) and would be happy to do cross-promotion with other YouTubers and potentially swap/trade services (I can direct and have gear). I am new to the area, so I'd love suggestions of good places to host this Meetup in the Newton or Boston area. 

- Michelle Osorio YouTuber behind Kill9TV

results.description:
This is a group to share, discuss, and get feedback on mathematically-oriented independent research ideas that members wish to pursue. The focus is on problems with a technical component. They can be in any field and need not emphasize pure mathematics. However, the research must involve reproducible mathematical calculations or computational procedures. The research should be original -- whether or not it turns out to be novel.

Many of us have interesting research ideas outside our formal area of expertise that we'd like to explore or actually are exploring.  Academic research has grown highly compartmentalized.  Determining an appropriate publication venue, tracking down relevant prior work, and casting language into field-specific terminology can easily become a full time job.  Even determining whether the work has been done before can be quite a challenging task.  We're often faced with a choice:  spend our free time solving interesting problems or spend it dealing with these tasks.  

The goal of this group is both to provide a forum for sharing such ideas and to aid members in exploring possible venues for publication where applicable.  

Here is a quick test to see if you would enjoy this group:

   1.  Do you tend to come up with interesting ideas, possibly in widely varying fields, with a mathish bent?  If the answer is no, then your meetup search criteria may need some work.

   2.  Do you actually have the time and inclination to solve those problems?  If the answer is no, then what you're looking for is a grad student.

   3.  Would you say you do enough quick checking to avoid spending "a month in the lab" to "save an hour in the library", as the old adage goes?  If not, then you may wish to try a magical incantation that goes "google".

   4.  Are you ok with (unknowingly) doing something that already has been done?  If the answer is no, then you need to spend the next 16 years of your life in academia developing cutting edge expertise in one field.

   5.  Would you say you have some sort of academic background in a technical discipline (physics, math, engineering, CS, etc), are familiar with the nature of scientific research, and follow such methods in your own research?  I.e., is your approach methodical, reproducible, and technical?  If not, then your ideas are brilliant and the establishment is persecuting you and you are way way way too smart for this group.  We'd never understand your perpetual motion idea and are too closed minded to hear you endlessly explain your latest conspiracy theory.  You're looking for the group next door.
   
   6.  Are you open to feedback, including criticism, and including being proven completely wrong?  While feedback in our group will be constructive, are you ready to hear -- "Hey, isn't that just the Jablowski equation?" or "Um, that missing minus sign invalidates your entire argument."?  If not, the you're probably looking for a mutual affirmation group.  If you need someone to simply tell you you're a genius, I can recommend this great guy on the corner in Harvard Square.  For just $10 he'll tell you that you're the smartest person on the planet and justify it by misquoting various famous people.  He services most of the Harvard faculty, from what I hear.
 
   7.  Are you open to writing up and presenting your idea?  If not, then you probably are onto something really really really big.  You should hide the encrypted hard drive in a safe that you sink in the ocean.  Don't forget to have (old) Spock cut out a piece of your brain and seal it in an alternate universe to protect you from yourself as well.  Otherwise, the government will steal and misuse it, other scientists will plagiarize it, and/or Apple will patent it and sue you.   
 
The problems our members tackle need not be profound or earth shattering.  The subjects can vary all over the place.  If you want a flavor of what I've played with recently, you can look at my idea blog "www.aplaceofsand.com" (it has a mix of other stuff too -- but the "Fairness in sentencing", "Inflation", and "Voting" articles are representative).  

For obvious reasons, I'm going to be selective in admission to this group.  This isn't (just) because I'm pretentious.  I want to ensure that members will share reasonable ideas and offer reasonable feedback.  If you read through this huge blurb, you've passed motivation test #1.  

Motivation test #2 involves sending me some work you did.  It can be an academic publication if you have one, or an unpublished piece.  For this purpose, it need not be a creative work (a pedagogical one will suffice).  However, it should have a technical aspect to it.  Also, please provide a brief description of your background and interests.  

I also reserve the right (and will exercise it) to revoke membership for anyone who meaningfully misrepresents themselves or their work.  Really, don't bother.  It will be blatantly obvious after 5 minutes of casual conversation.  You'll be unhappy and I'll be unhappy, and this group is about fun and happiness.
results.name: Boston Area Research Projects Group

results.description:
Awaken the Healing Power within Your Body and Mind

• Awaken your body and mind’s innate healing power
• Develop healthier and more fulfilling relationships
• Learn to work constructively with your own emotions
• Stimulate your minds innate problem solving capabilities
• Develop new resources and capabilities
• Become clear about your life’s purpose

Our bodies communicate with us all the time. Many of us are so over stimulated and stressed out that we cannot hear what our bodies are saying. We age faster and suffer many health problems when we do not know how to listen to what our body is telling us.
Discover the amazing wisdom that resides within your own body. Ben will show you how to develop your sensory awareness. Learn to truly listen to your body and care for its needs.
Stimulate the mind's creative problem solving capabilities by learning to "digest" issues, emotions and stresses
Many of us have never learned how to work with difficult issues and emotions. We tend to push these things down inside of ourselves. Undigested thoughts, issues, emotions and the stresses of daily life create a residue that accumulates within the tissues and organs of our bodies. That creates a great deal of additional stress upon our body and mind. These stresses can arrest our process of development, disconnect us from the divine creative intelligence of the universe and shut down our intuition. It also causes our bodies break down at a more rapid pace and that accelerates the aging process.
Learn to use your body-mind's innate healing power to "digest and assimilate" your thoughts feelings, emotions, issues and life experiences. You will begin to release the stresses that are held within the body and to heal the painful emotions associated with anxiety, depression and emotionally traumatic experiences. You will also learn to go right to the source of the issues to bring about a resolution that allows you to really move forward in your life.
Working with these practices helps to increase your intellectual and emotional range, improve memory, initiate new cycles of growth, awaken inner passions, spark creativity and deepen intuition. You will develop the strength and resilience that will make it easier for you to adapt to the demands that life places upon you.
Discover the passion and power that resides within you
Chinese Martial Arts Masters emphasize the development of a base of power known as the "dan tien". The stress of living in such a fast paced world can cause us to disconnect from our foundation. Undigested food, emotions and the stresses of daily life begin to accumulate within the abdomen. We may experience bloating and suffer from various digestive problems. Some of us begin to lose touch with our drive, passion, inspiration and the sense of knowing that reveals our true purpose as our instinctual base shuts down.
You will learn to become fully present within your body, to develop greater personal power, and to awaken the inner passion and sense of knowing that will bring give you a greater sense of clarity about your life's purpose.
Activate the healing intelligence that resides within the body and mind
We all have a powerful healing intelligence that resides within our bodies and minds. This innate healing power helps to mend our bodies any time we suffer an illness or injury. Our innate healing powers are often compromised by the stress and toxins that accumulate within our bodies.
Learn to activate the generative healing powers that reside within your own body and mind. Awaken the consciousness of the individual organs. Access and heal the emotions and core issues that are held within the body. These practices are very effective for healing digestive and respiratory disorders and a wide range of other health issues.
Alternate Tuesdays at 7:30 PM at Unity of Somerville, located at 6 William Street at the corner of College Avenue

Call (913) 927-4281 to learn more

Ben was drawn to indigenous cultures from an early age and found himself living among the Kiowa Tribe in Oklahoma at the age of seventeen. He began his training with Horace Daukei, the last surviving traditional doctor (medicine man) among the Kiowa Tribe. Ben went on to study with Chinese Master Li Tai Liang. He continues to train intensively in the Chinese systems of xin yi, bagua, tai chi and chi gong.
Please go to http://www.doiohm.com... or call (913) 927-4281 for more information
results.name: Awaken the Healing Power Within Your Body and Mind

results.description: Improvised music needs a better playground! Sonic Osmosis is our attempt to leak through the walls that box in this art form. Take a bunch of musicians, some of whom have never met, herd them into one space and allow them to freely interact -- no set times, no sound check, no stage, and no guarantee that an audience member won’t grab your bongos and start beating on them! Leave your expectations at the door, and pay attention! Someone might be talking to you from the other side of the room. Wander through the space to hear different mixes of what's happening, and if you feel inspired, jump into the fray! Do a dance! Recite a poem! Make some noise! Or just chill on the couch...no one will shine an unwanted spotlight on you. Sonic Osmosis is a monthly series at Out of the Blue Too Gallery (541 Mass. Ave., Cambridge, MA). Admission to our events is a $3-10 sliding scale for “audience members” (those who do not declare their art tools at the door), but we also ask the “artists” to donate to the gallery as well, cuz we all in this together! All money goes to the gallery, because this place rocks and we want to keep it around for a long, long time. If you’d like to attend or participate, please join us!
results.name: Sonic Osmosis - Cambridge

results.description:
Catholics Against Militarism is a lay Catholic movement that aims to expel militarism from the American Catholic Church by 1) registering dissent at the parish level, 2) raising awareness of the dangers of militarism through dialogue with fellow believers, and 3) spurring deeper, more honest reflection on the role of violence in our world.

The following statement is taken from our website:

1. Militarism discourages serious reflection on the moral gravity of war. 

A militaristic culture derives its power from a few basic assumptions:

The military is a force for good;
The military is only used in defense; 
Therefore military service is an honorable profession;
Therefore supporting the troops is a patriotic duty.

We believe these are faulty assumptions.

When we thank veterans for keeping us free and safe, we reassure them that particular, current wars are good, and necessary to keep us free and safe. When we congratulate teenagers for joining the military, we discourage them from considering the spiritual and psychological consequences of violence, enmity, destruction and the taking of human life. When we champion the United States as “the greatest country on Earth,” we overlook the dark side of American history: American exceptionalism provides the rich soil in which militarism takes root.

Militarism creates a convenient blind spot for the terrible costs of war. At its most bold, it dares and encourages young people to sacrifice their lives, and possibly their souls, at the unholy altar of the State.

2. Militarism is a spiritual disease akin to the worshiping of idols. 

The Ten Commandments reads Thou Shall Not Kill; Jesus Christ was the Prince of Peace; and Catholic tradition condemns war in the strongest terms. Manifest Destiny, American Exceptionalism, and Christian Nationalism have no basis in the Catholic understanding of the world. As explained by Cardinal Walter Kasper, an overly strong identification of the Gospel with a particular culture or nation is an “ecclesiological heresy.” Killing does not become okay simply because the killer was wearing the stars and stripes. The Bible makes it very clear that God judges people according to His laws, not Man’s laws.

“Obey God rather than men.” Acts 5:29
“No one man can serve two masters.” Matthew 6:24
“Thou Shalt Have No God Before Me.” Exodus 20:3

Please click this link to read the whole statement.

We encourage all Boston-area Catholics who agree with our goals to join even if they are not currently practicing the Faith. Non-Catholics may also join if they have a sincere and respectful interest in Catholicism and Catholic teaching. However, expect anti-Catholic ideas and opinions to be vigorously challenged. Remember, we still have the Catechism.
results.name: Boston Catholics Against Militarism

results.description:
About Us:

We are a travel group specifically geared towards solo travelers. Sometimes it can be difficult to find others to travel with and other times you get stuck being the 19th wheel in a group of all married people. We want to help with this situation by creating a travel group with ONLY solo travelers.

Who Should Join:

If you are a solo traveler who is truly interested in traveling and meeting great people along the way, we want to join! There's no limit to the places and things to do in the world, so come be part of the adventure!

Why You Should Join:

Meet other great people like yourself who have a thirst for travel and adventure! There are very few places in the world in which you can travel with only other solo travelers. We hope that this group will be a great way for you to meet new friends and have fun along the way!

What You Should Expect:

We will plan one or two trips per year based upon where people want to travel. This is completely open-ended and includes anywhere in the world--from Rome to Antarctica!

We look forward to meeting you!

results.description: This Meetup Group provides a forum for working artists to discuss the pleasures and challenges of our profession. Most of us work alone, from an internal road map, and might not have a place to share our experiences with others who've "been there". The purpose of the group is to support and encourage each other in making our best work. To do that we need to foster a strong daily artistic practice. Discussion topics for the group will include strategies for dealing with our inner critic and overcoming roadblocks, opportunities for sharing our work with others and issues that can arise as a result, techniques for time management and habit creation, sources of inspiration, and more. We'll also share our resources for eye-opening books we've read or classes we've taken; ideas about how we've set up our work environment to get and stay in the zone; and favorite materials, tools and supply houses. Come and meet others who have something pretty fundamental in common with you...and maybe make some new artist friends! My intention is that this become a small, committed group of 5-7 artists. I'm looking for people who - if the group is a fit - are willing and able to attend regular monthly meetings, to be held on weekday afternoons. Therefore, as soon as we have a solid group, membership will close and only re-open if a member leaves the group. The idea is that this will enable us to benefit from really getting to know and trust one other and to foster a sense of accountability and community.
results.name: The Boston Working Artists Meetup

results.description:
“Beauty of the Beast: Motorcycles - Art, Form, Function, Freedom”, a new exhibit at the Larz Anderson Auto Museum exploring the motorcycle from an artistic, historic, mechanical and cultural perspective. The year-long exhibit will examine the life history of the motorcycle, from the pioneering 1800’s era - when an engine was simply bolted to a bicycle  – through the present day technological and artistic triumphs achieved by manufacturers in Asia, Europe and the United States, leading to a shift in cultural perceptions, and a world-wide fan base of enthusiasts.  The exhibit features some of the rarest, most technically innovative, historically significant, and beautiful motorcycles of all time, brought together within the context of the history of the automobile, examining technological and style parallels and the evolution of the motorcycle from an inexpensive alternative to the motorcar to a distinct entity and potent social and cultural symbol.  Abounding with visually compelling examples of the impact of the motorcycle on popular culture, the exhibit will recall for the visitor such classics as “Easy Rider”, “The Wild One”, “The World’s Fastest Indian”, and other iconic cinematic portrayals of the motorcycle as the ultimate expression of freedom. Iconic brands such as BMW, Ducati, Harley Davidson, Honda and Indian will be among the featured marques. The competitive speed arena will be well represented at “Beauty of the Beast” with the 1970 Harley Davidson Sportster Powered Streamliner from the Bonneville Motorcycle family, and both the Pro Mod Suzuki TL 1000 and Suzuki Hyabusa motorcycles used by NHRA Pro Stock Motorcycle racer Sam Herwitz, a Newton, MA resident and drag racing legend, all part of the racing and competitive riding section of the exhibit. The very newest, most exotic motorcycles the world factories have to offer, including the Ducati 119
Superleggera “superbike” will be on display as will a complete representation of the century’s best in motorcycling.  Legends like the Vincent Black Shadow from England, a rare MV Augusta, and a historically significant 1935 Morgan Super Sport Three-Wheeler will highlight the evolutionary variations of the motorcycle.  European greats including the 1923 BMW r32, which was part of the Art of the Motorcycle at Guggenheim, acclaimed for rocketing BMW’s motorcycle success with its masterful design concept that would endure the rest of the century, and the 1935 BMW r17, representing the height of the Art Deco movement, will punctuate the mechanical, artistic, design and styling aspects of the Motorcycle.   “Leather and Lace – Women and Motorcycles”, will explore the relationship of women to motorcycles and focus on some outstanding individuals who made history on the seat of their own machine and in the motorcycle world, whether breaking barriers, making their own mark or through outstanding feats of their own.  The “Beauty of the Beast” exhibit runs through the year, concurrently with the popular summer “Lawn Events” auto shows schedule.  Admission is: $10 for adults, $5 children, seniors, and active military.  For more information or to become involved in the exhibit please contact: Sheldon Steele at 617-522-6547, admin@larzanderson.org, or visit:  www.larzanderson.org.  
Larz Anderson Auto Museum   15 Newton Street  Brookline MA 02445
results.name: Bikers Ride to see Brookline Museum Motorcycle Exhibit

topics.name: Order of Bards Ovates and Druids (OBOD)

results.description:
This section is "Under Construction"

Coming this Fall!

Céad Míle Fáilte (one hundred thousand welcomes)

The Forest Path is a study group for individuals interested in learning more about the spiritual tradition known as Druidry. Who were the Druids?? And more importantly who are they today? What does this tradition have to offer you and the world? Join the group to find out. 

Members will gather for monthly "hearthsides" which are pot-luck social gatherings and discussions on a diverse range of topics related to the ancient to the modern understanding of Druidry including its history and folklore, philosophy, theology, environmental and social applications, and how this earth-based spiritual tradition can inform today's global issues. Like many modern pagan traditions, Druidry exists in the sphere of a personal/experiential path, without dogma, that each of us must learn to walk and interpret for ourselves. Seen today more as a "spiritually informed philosophy of life" than a religion in the traditional sense, this path is completely compatible with many lifestyles regardless of your own cultural and/or religions background.

Members will also be invited to participate in the eight sacred seasonal holy days of the Druid calendar, which will be held outdoors in natural settings.

Who should join this group? Anyone interested in learning more about this unique spiritual tradition.

Do you need to be of Celtic ancestry to join? Certainly not. All that is required is an open mind.

Do you need to be a pagan to join? Certainly not. Modern Druidry (often referred to as neo-druidry) is a sophisticated spiritually-informed philosophy and way-of-life more than a traditional "religion" per say and it's ideas can be applied in many dimensions of life regardless of your background. Arising from ancient indo-european sources, yet informed by in modern ideas and constantly evolving, Druidry today transcends eastern and western worldviews as it transcends the spiritual and scientific divides to offer a way of "being in the world" that is firmly grounded by its connection to nature and the environment, yet committed to helping humanity grow towards a more enlightened society.

This is a closed group and only members can see internal content including the locations of events.

Members will be approved based on their expressed desire to particulate actively in social/educational events as well as the more experiential celebrations. Members ought to have the minimum physical constitution and interest to participate in events held outdoors in natural locations under diverse weather conditions. The eight sacred days of the Druid calendar will be celebrated shine barring extreme situations, and if you are only an "indoor celebrant" or have an aversion to getting your shoes and trousers a bit muddy then this group might not be for you. Locations will be accessible to the Boston area as much as possible.

This group is the initial step towards establishing a local "seed group" within the Order of Bards Ovates & Druids (OBOD). Active involvement in the Order's distance-learning training program is highly encouraged but not required, nor is membership in OBOD a requirement for this group. For more information of the Order and its program, visit www.druidry.org 

Events are planned to commence this autumn 2015.

We hope you can join us on this journey.

A oes heddwch?

Stay tuned as more develops.
results.name: The Forest Path: A Druid Study Group

Our passion is to uplift, inspire, educate, motivate, guide and transform everyone and anyone to become the Self you always intended to be, your Intentional Self!

Allow us to incite your mind, body and spirit to re-connect with the inner source of all intelligence and abundance.

Our "Sacred Sanctuary Sundays" are for those who are really not into "church type services, but still want to connect with our Creator in a safe, spiritually energizing space with like-minded and like-hearted friends.

"Sacred Source" is a non-denominational Sunday fellowship for beginners on the Ascension Path. We'll share Sacred teachings and readings from the Masters, then engage in discussion, prayer, meditations and affirmations to help you realize and live your true God-Self. (1st & 3rd Sundays with Rev, Sandy)

"Sanctuary of Divine Presence" is a non-denominational, multi-cultural fellowship of people who gather to experience and share the peace, healing and restorative Presence of the Divine. It incorporates an Ascension Service and Sound Balm. (2nd & 4th Sundays with Rev. Tonia)

Both services are accompanied by the healing and spiritually energizing tones of Singing Bowls by Stephanie Woods, the Singing Bowl Lady. 

Sacred Sanctuary Sundays needs your support. We do not charge for these Spiritual Services, but we still need to pay the bills. Your voluntary Offering of $10 or more will be greatly appreciated in order to continue these alternative Sunday services.

Peace, Love and Many Blessings!

Rev. Sandy and Rev. Tonia

Both of these jams are great for jazz fan who just want to come and enjoy the music!

For Instrumentalists: 

The first Sunday of each month will be a jazz jam will take place from 6:00-8:30 at Artlounge Arlington 1346 Massachusetts Ave, Arlington, MA 02476 

There is a $6 cover and Artlounge serves beer, wine, and food. This jam is for instrumentalists. Keyboard, amps and drums are provided.

For Vocalists:

Singers are encouraged to come to our other monthly jam, Boston Jazz Singer Showcase at Ryles Jazz Club. Come get backed by a pro rhythm section and sing at a real jazz club in front of your peers! This is a great chance for the amateur vocalist to get experience a great band at a real club and also for the pro singer to keep their performing chops up and try out new material. This is not a set week each month. Next ones are 7/21, 8/11, and 9/15. $7 cover  212 Hampshire St, Cambridge
results.name: Morningside Studio Jazz Jams/Events in Arlington & Cambridge

topics.name: Executive and business coaching and mentoring

results.description:
This group was created for business owners or executives looking to sharpen their skill sets.  If you aspire to lead, improve your current abilities or simply want to become a better professional, join the group!  Ideal members are under 40, but all ages are welcome!

We will cover topics such as management, sales, negotiating, public speaking, communications, implementing change, start-ups, marketing, training, technology, coaching, hiring/discipline/firing, competition, market research, consulting, health/wellness, advertising, using the Internet, print, structure, strategy, industry trends and more!
results.name: Innovative Executive Coaching

results.name: Sharon Montessori School

results.description:
This group is only for professional wedding-event vendors.

Networking is about making connection and building beneficial relationships.

It is not about who you know! But who knows you!
To succeed in business you need continually build new connections and meet new people.

This group is all about professional business networking.

If you are wedding photographer, DJ, wedding planner, florist, make up artist, hair stylist, spa owner, videographer, owner of a wedding venue or bridal salon, wedding band, calligrapher, invitation designer, wedding designer etc. this group is for you. This group designated for wedding-event vendors to help each other in creating successful referral business in Greater Boston Area.

Networking is very important part of business, lets start doing it today! Most of the meet up will be held in North of Boston Area.
results.name: Wedding Vendors Networking, Greater Boston Area

results.description:
We are a group of small professional business owners who are looking to grow our network and our business. This Meet-Up group is geared towards helping you expand your network and to help you learn tools and techniques to grow your business.
We will be meeting weekly on Thursday mornings from 8-9 am in Brookline, MA. We are part of the national group of Master Networks. Come, network and learn about our group and get to know like-minded individuals. Once established we will become a closed networking group. .
results.name: Jamaica Plain Small Business Meetup
